university_name: Indian Institute of Technology Bombay (IIT Bombay)

overview.type: Public/Government, Institute of National Importance and Institution of Eminence
overview.campus_size: Approximately 550 acres (around 2.2 square kilometres) of green, residential campus in Powai, Mumbai
overview.description: Indian Institute of Technology Bombay (IIT Bombay) is a premier public technical and research university established in 1958 in Powai, Mumbai, and was one of the earliest IITs created to drive India’s post‑independence industrial and technological development.[1][2] It was the first IIT set up with foreign assistance, receiving support from UNESCO with funding in Soviet roubles from the then Soviet Union, which helped build its laboratories, infrastructure and early academic ecosystem.[1][2] In 1961, Parliament declared the IITs, including IIT Bombay, as Institutes of National Importance, formally recognizing their role as the country’s apex engineering and technology institutions and embedding them in India’s national development agenda.[2][4] Over the decades, IIT Bombay has grown from a relatively small institute with an initial batch of about 100 students to a comprehensive science, engineering, design, management and humanities university with multiple undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral programs and a strong emphasis on interdisciplinary research.[1][2] The institute now comprises numerous academic departments, centres and schools, and has built a reputation as one of India’s and Asia’s top engineering institutions, consistently appearing near the top of national and international rankings for engineering, technology and overall university performance.[1][7] In 2018, IIT Bombay was granted the prestigious “Institution of Eminence” status by the Government of India, enabling greater academic, financial and administrative autonomy to pursue world‑class research and global collaborations.[1] The lush 550‑acre Powai campus, set around the Powai Lake and surrounded by hills, is fully residential and is known for its vibrant student culture, with strong traditions in technical festivals, cultural events, entrepreneurship, student clubs and sports, creating a holistic campus life beyond academics.[1][2] IIT Bombay has produced a large and influential alumni network that includes leading industrialists, technology entrepreneurs, researchers, academic leaders and policy‑makers, contributing to sectors such as information technology, manufacturing, finance, consulting, startups and public service in India and abroad.[2][6] In recent years, the institute has strengthened its global presence through international collaborations, joint research projects, student and faculty exchange programs and participation in global innovation networks, while also playing a central role in India’s startup ecosystem through incubators and entrepreneurial support structures.[2][7] Overall, IIT Bombay is widely regarded as a flagship institution in India’s higher education system, symbolizing excellence in engineering and technology education, cutting‑edge research, innovation, and nation‑building, with a sustained emphasis on meritocratic admissions and rigorous academic standards.[1][2]

rankings: NIRF 2024 Engineering: Frequently ranked among the top 3 engineering institutions in India under the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) of the Ministry of Education; IIT Bombay typically competes with IIT Madras and IIT Delhi for the top positions in the engineering category, reflecting its strong academic reputation, research output, graduate outcomes and perception scores.[2][6]

NIRF Overall Category: Consistently placed among the leading institutions in the NIRF Overall rankings, indicating not only excellence in engineering but also strength in multidisciplinary research, industry collaboration, inclusivity, and outreach metrics across the entire institute.[2]

Institution of Eminence (Government of India, 2018): Designated as an ‘Institution of Eminence’ in 2018, a recognition awarded to a small group of Indian universities with the potential to become world‑class, giving IIT Bombay enhanced autonomy, special funding windows, and policy support to expand international collaborations and high‑impact research.[1][2]

QS World University Rankings – Engineering & Technology: Regularly ranked among the top global universities in Engineering & Technology in the QS World University Rankings, often placed among the highest‑ranked Indian institutions in this subject area, which reflects international academic reputation, employer reputation, research citations and internationalization indicators.[6][7]

QS World University Rankings – Overall: Appears in the global QS World University Rankings as one of India’s leading higher education institutions, typically in a band that underscores its status as a strong research‑focused technical university with growing global visibility and collaboration.[6][7]

Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings: Listed in THE World University Rankings as a prominent Indian institution, with performance particularly strong in engineering, physical sciences and computer science, and improving scores in citation impact and industry income that highlight its growing research influence and partnerships.[7]

Times Higher Education – Asia Rankings: Recognized among Asia’s leading universities in THE Asia University Rankings, reflecting IIT Bombay’s regional prominence in teaching, research, citations, international outlook and industry engagement.[7]

National & International Employer Reputation: In global rankings that measure employer reputation (such as QS), IIT Bombay often records very strong scores, indicating that its graduates are highly valued by recruiters both in India and abroad for their technical proficiency, problem‑solving ability and overall professional readiness.[6][7]

Top Status within IIT System: Within the network of Indian Institutes of Technology, IIT Bombay is widely regarded—along with IIT Madras, IIT Delhi and IIT Kharagpur—as one of the most sought‑after IITs by top JEE Advanced rankers, which, while not a formal ranking, serves as a strong indicator of its perceived quality and competitiveness among aspirants and academia.[1][6]

Research and Innovation Recognition: IIT Bombay frequently appears in national listings and surveys as a leading institution in terms of patents filed, research publications, industry‑sponsored projects and startup/incubation activity, reinforcing its ranking as a premier centre for research and innovation in engineering and technology.[2][6]

courses_and_fees.course_name: B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering (CSE)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: For Indian nationals, the B.Tech tuition fee at IITs is generally of the order of a few lakh rupees per year, with additional charges for hostel, mess, and institute facilities; fee structures are periodically revised by the Government of India, and IIT Bombay follows this centrally guided pattern with provisions for tuition waivers and financial assistance for economically weaker sections, Scheduled Castes, Scheduled Tribes and certain other categories.[2][6] The total cost of study over four years typically comprises tuition, registration, examination, hostel rent, mess advances, medical insurance, and various one‑time charges such as admission and security deposits, though exact contemporary figures must be confirmed from the official IIT Bombay website and admission brochure for the relevant academic year.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission to the B.Tech CSE program is primarily through the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE Advanced), for which students must first qualify in JEE Main and meet age, attempt and academic criteria prescribed by the exam authorities.[6] Candidates must have completed 10+2 (or equivalent) with Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics, and must satisfy category‑wise cut‑offs in JEE Advanced that are typically among the highest in the country, as CSE at IIT Bombay is one of the most competitive programs with closing ranks often within the top few hundred All India ranks.[6] Additional eligibility includes meeting specific requirements for reserved categories, medical fitness norms, and completion of required documentation during JoSAA (Joint Seat Allocation Authority) counselling and reporting.

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The tuition fee structure for B.Tech in Electrical Engineering is aligned with the standard B.Tech fee for IITs, with annual tuition forming the major component and additional charges covering hostel accommodation, mess, utilities, student welfare and academic infrastructure usage; these amounts are subject to revision as per Government of India and IIT Council decisions.[2][6] Scholarships, fee waivers, and educational loans are commonly used by students, and there are multiple institute and external schemes to support meritorious and financially needy students.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission is through JEE Advanced, following qualification in JEE Main, and candidates must have a strong background in Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics at the 10+2 level from a recognized board.[6] Electrical Engineering at IIT Bombay is highly sought‑after, usually closing at a very high All India Rank in JEE Advanced, and admission is allocated through centralized JoSAA counselling based on rank, category, and seat availability, along with standard eligibility and document verification requirements.

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The Mechanical Engineering B.Tech program follows the same general undergraduate fee framework as other B.Tech programs at IIT Bombay, with tuition fees for each semester, along with hostel fees, mess charges, and miscellaneous academic and student activity fees; these are periodically updated and exact amounts are published in institute fee notifications.[2] Economically disadvantaged students can benefit from tuition waivers, scholarships and financial aid schemes administered by the institute and government bodies.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Eligibility requires qualification in JEE Advanced (after clearing JEE Main) with strong performance in Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics, and candidates must satisfy age limits, number of attempts, and minimum percentage or rank criteria as detailed by the examination authorities.[6] Seat allotment is conducted via JoSAA counselling, where Mechanical Engineering at IIT Bombay is among the higher‑ranked branches and therefore attracts strong applicants with good All India Ranks; category reservations and associated relaxations also apply as per government norms.

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The Civil Engineering B.Tech program tuition fee is consistent with IIT Bombay’s standard B.Tech fee policy, consisting of semester‑wise tuition along with institute, hostel and mess charges; any changes are notified by the institute before each academic year.[2] Students from reserved categories and lower income groups may obtain partial or full tuition fee remission along with access to scholarships and financial assistance from the institute and external funding agencies.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission is secured through JEE Advanced after qualifying JEE Main, with the requirement of having completed 10+2 with Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics from a recognized board and meeting the minimum performance criteria.[6] Seats are allocated through JoSAA counselling based on JEE Advanced rank, category and preferences, and Civil Engineering remains a core discipline attracting students with strong interests in infrastructure, structural engineering, transportation and environmental engineering.

courses_and_fees.course_name: Dual Degree (B.Tech + M.Tech) Programs in various Engineering disciplines
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The integrated B.Tech + M.Tech dual degree programs follow a fee structure comparable to the B.Tech program for the first four years, with the fifth year also charged at the applicable postgraduate or integrated program rate as notified; the cumulative cost includes tuition, hostel and mess fees for five years, making overall fees higher in absolute terms but often lower than pursuing separate B.Tech and M.Tech degrees sequentially.[2] Students may benefit from scholarships in later years based on academic performance and category, and the integrated structure often allows more efficient use of financial and time resources.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission is through JEE Advanced, as for standalone B.Tech programs, with candidates opting for dual degree seats during JoSAA counselling based on their All India Rank, category and program preferences.[6] Students need to meet the same 10+2 Science stream requirements and are subject to similar eligibility norms, but the integrated program is designed for those intending to pursue advanced specialization and research‑oriented careers, and thus attracts students with a clear long‑term academic or technical focus.

courses_and_fees.course_name: M.Tech Programs (various specializations such as Computer Science & Engineering, Electrical, Mechanical, Civil, Chemical, Aerospace and others)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: M.Tech tuition fees at IIT Bombay are typically lower on an effective net basis for GATE‑qualified students, since many receive monthly stipends (assistantships) funded by the Government of India, along with subsidized tuition; official fee circulars specify semester‑wise tuition, institute charges, hostel rent and mess advances.[2][6] The total expenditure over two years includes academic and living costs, but the stipend system makes postgraduate study financially accessible for many, especially those from modest backgrounds.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission to M.Tech programs is primarily based on a valid Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) score in a relevant discipline, with candidates required to meet minimum score and qualifying criteria set by IIT Bombay for each specialization.[6] Applicants must hold an appropriate B.E./B.Tech or equivalent degree (and in some cases an M.Sc. for certain interdisciplinary programs) with prescribed minimum CPI/percentage, and selection may involve additional written tests or interviews for some departments; sponsored and part‑time categories may have different eligibility norms and do not always require GATE if supported by recognized organizations.

courses_and_fees.course_name: M.Sc Programs (Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics and other sciences/interdisciplinary areas)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The M.Sc programs at IIT Bombay follow a postgraduate fee structure that includes tuition per semester along with other academic and hostel‑related fees, and may be supported by scholarships or fellowships for eligible students, especially those entering through national examinations.[2] Overall costs are typically lower than professional engineering programs, and the institute provides access to well‑equipped laboratories, libraries and research facilities within this fee framework.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission to M.Sc programs is usually through national‑level entrance tests such as the Joint Admission Test for M.Sc. (IIT JAM) or similar examinations for relevant disciplines, with candidates required to have a B.Sc. or equivalent degree in an appropriate subject and to meet specified minimum marks or CGPA criteria.[6] Departments may set subject‑specific prerequisites (for example, mathematics coursework for certain fields), and final selection can involve merit lists based on exam scores, category‑wise reservation policies, and document verification at the time of admission.

courses_and_fees.course_name: MBA (Master of Business Administration) through Shailesh J. Mehta School of Management (SJMSOM)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The MBA program at IIT Bombay, offered by SJMSOM, carries a professional postgraduate fee structure that is higher than many non‑professional postgraduate programs, reflecting the intensive management curriculum, industry interaction, and placement services; the total program fee typically includes tuition, academic charges, and hostel and mess expenses over two years, and is detailed each year in the official admissions brochure.[2] Educational loans and limited scholarships or assistantships may be available, and the strong placement records often help graduates manage the cost of education relative to their expected post‑MBA earnings.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Eligibility for admission to the MBA program generally includes a valid score in a national‑level management entrance exam such as the Common Admission Test (CAT), along with a bachelor’s degree in any discipline from a recognized university with a specified minimum percentage or CGPA.[6] Shortlisted candidates are invited for further evaluation processes such as Written Ability Tests (WAT), Group Discussions (GD) and Personal Interviews, and work experience, academic record, and diversity factors may be considered in the final selection process, consistent with management admission practices in leading Indian institutes.
courses_and_fees.note: While specific entrance tests and weightages can change over time, IIT Bombay’s management admissions remain highly competitive and emphasize analytical ability, communication skills and leadership potential.

courses_and_fees.course_name: Ph.D. Programs (Engineering, Sciences, Humanities & Social Sciences, Management and Interdisciplinary areas)
courses_and_fees.duration: Typically 3–6 Years (Full‑time; part‑time/external options in some cases)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: Ph.D. students at IIT Bombay generally pay comparatively modest tuition and institute fees per semester, and many full‑time scholars receive fellowships or assistantships (from the institute, government agencies or sponsored projects) that cover living expenses and, in some cases, part of the fee burden.[2] The total financial outlay thus depends heavily on the funding source and duration of the program, but the institute’s policy framework is designed to make doctoral research viable for talented candidates irrespective of socio‑economic background.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Eligibility for Ph.D. admission includes a relevant Master’s degree (M.Tech, M.E., M.Sc., M.A., MBA or equivalent) or, in some cases, a strong B.Tech/B.E. with high CGPA from a recognized university or institute, along with performance in national‑level tests like GATE, CSIR‑UGC NET, or equivalent qualifications, depending on discipline.[6] Departments may require written tests, research proposals and interviews to assess a candidate’s research aptitude and fit with faculty interests, and there are provisions for sponsored, external and part‑time Ph.D. candidates with appropriate professional experience and organizational support.

placements.description: The placement scenario at IIT Bombay is widely regarded as one of the strongest among Indian engineering and technology institutions, with both undergraduate and postgraduate students receiving robust campus recruitment opportunities each year across core engineering, IT, consulting, finance, analytics and emerging sectors.[2][6] The institute’s centralized Placement Office coordinates an organized placement season, typically split into phases, where hundreds of national and international companies visit the campus to recruit for full‑time roles as well as internships, often starting with pre‑placement talks followed by aptitude tests, group discussions, technical interviews and HR rounds. Over the years, IIT Bombay has seen a sustained upward trend in the number of offers and the diversity of profiles, with many students securing high‑value roles in software engineering, product development, quant finance, data science, consulting, R&D and technology management.[2] Average and median salary packages for B.Tech and dual‑degree graduates are generally among the highest in the country for engineering programs, reflecting strong employer confidence in IIT Bombay’s rigorous curriculum and the problem‑solving and analytical skills of its students.[6] The institute also records some of the highest domestic salary offers from elite consulting firms, investment banks, trading firms and top technology companies, along with notable international offers from global technology majors and financial organizations. Internship opportunities are an integral part of the placement ecosystem, with many students undertaking summer internships after their pre‑final year in leading companies; these internships frequently convert into pre‑placement offers (PPOs), thereby providing early career security and industry exposure. Ph.D. and M.Tech students also benefit from campus placements, especially in R&D, core engineering, academia, data analytics and specialized technical roles, and the institute’s reputation in research makes its doctoral graduates attractive to universities and research labs worldwide. The alumni network plays a significant role in strengthening placements by acting as recruiters, mentors and referral points, which, combined with strong industry relationships, helps IIT Bombay maintain a broad and high‑quality recruiter base across sectors.[2] In addition to conventional corporate placements, a growing number of students are engaging with the institute’s entrepreneurship and incubation ecosystem, choosing to work on startups or join early‑stage companies, and the placement apparatus has adapted to recognize this diversified definition of successful career outcomes. Overall, IIT Bombay’s placement record reflects its standing as a top‑tier institution whose graduates are seen as industry‑ready professionals and future leaders in technology, business and research, and whose campus recruitment outcomes remain a key benchmark for other engineering colleges in India.[2][6]
placements.highest_package: IIT Bombay routinely witnesses some of the highest compensation offers made to engineering graduates in India, including very high domestic packages and international packages that can reach into substantial figures when converted to Indian rupees; exact numerical values vary from year to year and are officially reported by the institute’s placement office for each placement season.
placements.average_package: Average and median salary figures for B.Tech, dual degree, M.Tech and MBA graduates are consistently among the top tier in the country, but specific values differ by batch, discipline and market conditions and are best referenced from IIT Bombay’s official annual placement reports; overall trends indicate strong growth and competitive remuneration across branches.

facilities: Central Library: IIT Bombay’s central library is a major academic resource centre that houses a large collection of books, reference volumes, journals, theses, reports and electronic resources across engineering, science, humanities, management and interdisciplinary areas, and provides access to numerous online databases, e‑journals and digital libraries.[2] It offers reading halls, digital access terminals, reprography and inter‑library loan services, supporting both coursework and advanced research.

Departmental and Central Research Laboratories: The institute maintains advanced research labs within departments and centralized facilities equipped with modern instrumentation, high‑end computation resources, experimental setups and specialized equipment for fields such as nanotechnology, materials science, electronics, biotechnology, energy and environmental engineering, enabling cutting‑edge research and sponsored projects.[2] These labs support both academic research and industrial consultancy work.

Computer and High‑Performance Computing Facilities: IIT Bombay provides extensive computing infrastructure, including departmental computer centres and institute‑level high‑performance computing (HPC) clusters, which support large‑scale simulations, data analysis and advanced research in computational science and engineering.[2] High‑speed campus networks, Wi‑Fi access in academic and residential areas, and licensed software resources facilitate coursework, projects and research activities.

Hostels and Residential Facilities: The campus is fully residential for most students and offers multiple hostels for men and women, each with rooms, common rooms, recreational areas and mess facilities, creating a strong sense of community and peer learning.[1][2] Residential quarters for faculty and staff contribute to an academic environment where interaction between students and teachers extends beyond classrooms.

Student Messes, Canteens and Food Courts: Every hostel is typically associated with a mess that serves regular meals, and the campus additionally hosts various canteens, cafés and food outlets offering diverse cuisines, catering to different tastes and dietary preferences.[2] This infrastructure supports the residential nature of the institute and contributes to campus culture and informal student gatherings.

Sports and Recreation Facilities: IIT Bombay has a range of sports infrastructure including grounds and courts for cricket, football, basketball, volleyball, athletics and lawn tennis, as well as indoor facilities for badminton, table tennis, squash and gymnasiums for fitness and strength training.[2] Organized sports events, inter‑hostel competitions and institute‑level teams encourage physical fitness, teamwork and a balanced lifestyle for students.

Auditoriums, Lecture Halls and Classrooms: The institute features large auditoriums, seminar halls and modern lecture theatres equipped with audio‑visual and ICT facilities, suitable for lectures, conferences, workshops, cultural programs and major festivals.[2] Classrooms are designed to support interactive teaching, with projectors and connectivity that enable blended learning and effective dissemination of course content.

Innovation, Incubation and Entrepreneurship Centres: IIT Bombay hosts incubation facilities and entrepreneurship cells that support student and faculty startups with mentoring, seed funding linkage, workspace and access to networks of investors and industry experts.[2] These centres are integral to the institute’s innovation ecosystem and contribute to the growth of technology‑driven startups and entrepreneurial culture on campus.

Cultural, Technical and Student Activity Spaces: Dedicated spaces for student clubs, cultural groups, music, drama, photography, robotics, coding and other technical societies provide students with venues to pursue co‑curricular interests, organize events and collaborate on projects beyond formal coursework.[2] Major festivals like technical and cultural fests use these venues and help advance soft skills and leadership abilities.

Health Centre and Medical Facilities: The campus includes a health centre or hospital‑type facility that provides primary healthcare, routine consultations and emergency services to students, staff and faculty, often complemented by tie‑ups with larger hospitals in Mumbai for specialized care.[2] Health insurance and preventive health programs further support the well‑being of the campus community.

Campus Transport and Basic Amenities: Internal bus or shuttle services, bicycle‑friendly roads and well‑planned pathways facilitate mobility within the expansive Powai campus, and basic amenities such as banks, ATMs, post office counters, stationery shops and convenience stores are available to support day‑to‑day needs.[2] These amenities help create a self‑contained campus where most requirements can be met without frequent travel outside.

Residential and Social Infrastructure for Faculty and Staff: Housing complexes for faculty and staff, community centres, playgrounds and shared recreational spaces strengthen the institute’s residential character and promote an integrated academic community.[2] Such infrastructure supports long‑term association of faculty and their families with the campus, contributing to institutional continuity and culture.

Environmental and Green Spaces: The 550‑acre campus features abundant greenery, tree‑lined avenues, open spaces and its proximity to Powai Lake and surrounding hills, providing an aesthetically pleasing and relatively tranquil environment within the metropolis of Mumbai.[1][2] These natural surroundings support outdoor activities, offer spaces for relaxation and make the campus an attractive place to live and study.

Conference and Continuing Education Facilities: IIT Bombay has facilities to host national and international conferences, symposiums and continuing education programs, including dedicated halls, guest houses and training rooms.[2] These enable the institute to conduct professional development programs, industry training and academic events at scale, strengthening ties with industry and academia globally.

university_name: Indian Institute of Technology Delhi (IIT Delhi)

overview.established_year: 1961 (originating as the College of Engineering & Technology, later declared an Institution of National Importance under the Institutes of Technology (Amendment) Act, 1963 and renamed IIT Delhi)
overview.location: Hauz Khas, New Delhi, Delhi, India
overview.type: Public/Government, Institute of National Importance and Deemed University
overview.campus_size: Approximately 320 acres urban campus in Hauz Khas, South Delhi
overview.description: Indian Institute of Technology Delhi (IIT Delhi) is one of India’s premier Institutes of National Importance, established in 1961 as the College of Engineering & Technology and later brought under the Institutes of Technology Act to function as an autonomous, degree‑granting IIT with full academic and administrative powers.[1] Located in Hauz Khas, South Delhi, the institute occupies a sprawling, self‑contained 300+ acre campus that integrates academic buildings, laboratories, hostels, residential areas, sports facilities, and green spaces, creating an ecosystem that feels like a small technologically driven township within the capital city.[1][7] Historically, IIT Delhi emerged through Indo‑UK collaboration, with the British government and the Federation of British Industries supporting the creation of the Delhi Engineering College Trust and the development of the Hauz Khas campus, reflecting early international cooperation in shaping India’s higher technical education.[1][3] Over the decades, IIT Delhi has evolved from a primarily undergraduate engineering college to a broad‑based, research‑intensive technological university with strong programs in engineering, sciences, design, management, and interdisciplinary areas, consistently ranked among the top engineering institutions in India and well regarded internationally.[1][7] The institute is noted for its rigorous academic curriculum, competitive entry through national examinations such as JEE (Advanced) and GATE, and a culture that emphasizes both strong theoretical foundations and hands‑on problem solving, which has produced a large alumni network of influential technologists, entrepreneurs, academics, and policy leaders.[1][5] Its research profile spans cutting‑edge domains including artificial intelligence, communications and signal processing, renewable energy, nanotechnology, materials science, biotechnology, transportation systems, and public policy, with many faculty‑led centers of excellence and industry‑funded laboratories that contribute to national missions and global scientific literature.[1][7] Campus culture at IIT Delhi is known for being intellectually intense yet vibrant, with numerous technical societies, cultural clubs, entrepreneurship cells, and student‑run festivals such as Rendezvous and Tryst, which attract participants from institutions across India and offer a platform for innovation, arts, and leadership development.[1][8] The institute plays a key role in national development by providing high‑quality technical manpower, collaborating with government agencies and industry on strategic projects, incubating startups through its technology business incubators and research parks, and advising on policy issues related to infrastructure, digital transformation, energy, and sustainability.[1][5] In recent years, IIT Delhi has increased its global engagement through international joint degree programs, research partnerships, student and faculty exchanges, and membership in global academic networks, thereby strengthening its reputation as a globally connected yet nationally rooted institution.[7] Collectively, IIT Delhi’s historical legacy, academic excellence, strong placement outcomes, entrepreneurial ecosystem, and location in India’s political and administrative capital make it one of the most sought‑after destinations for science and engineering education in the country and a critical pillar in India’s knowledge and innovation landscape.[1][5][7]

rankings: NIRF 2024 Engineering: Consistently ranked among the top engineering institutions in India; in recent NIRF Engineering rankings, IIT Delhi has typically featured within the top 3–5 engineering institutes nationally, reflecting strong performance in teaching, learning resources, research output, graduation outcomes, and perception indicators.

NIRF 2024 Overall / University: In the overall and university‑specific categories, IIT Delhi has also been placed among the country’s leading institutions, indicating its comprehensive strength beyond engineering through contributions in sciences, management, design, and interdisciplinary research, as measured by NIRF criteria such as outreach and inclusivity, research funding, and professional practice.

QS World University Rankings (recent cycle): IIT Delhi has been regularly featured in the QS World University Rankings within the top global universities, often appearing among the top Indian institutions, highlighting its international academic reputation, employer reputation, faculty‑student ratio, and research citations per faculty, as well as growing global visibility of its programs.

QS World University Rankings by Subject – Engineering & Technology: In QS subject rankings, IIT Delhi is typically placed prominently in the global band for Engineering & Technology, reflecting strong citation impact, international collaborations, and employer recognition of its graduates in core engineering and technological disciplines.

QS World University Rankings by Subject – Computer Science & Information Systems: IIT Delhi’s computer science‑related programs have historically appeared in QS subject rankings for Computer Science and Information Systems, indicating a robust research environment in algorithms, systems, AI/ML, networks, and data science, as well as solid industry linkages and graduate outcomes.

Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings – Engineering & Technology: IIT Delhi has figured in THE rankings for Engineering & Technology, which evaluate teaching, research volume and influence, industry income, and international outlook, underscoring the institute’s role as a major global player in engineering higher education and research from India.

National and sectoral rankings for innovation and entrepreneurship: IIT Delhi is widely regarded as one of the top Indian campuses for innovation and entrepreneurship, frequently recognized in national innovation rankings, startup ecosystem assessments, and government or industry evaluations that consider patents filed, startups incubated, technology transfer, and industry collaboration activities.

Reputation among employers and academia: Across various national and international surveys, IIT Delhi consistently scores highly in employer reputation and academic reputation indicators, reflecting long‑standing confidence among recruiters, research partners, and peer institutions in the quality, skills, and adaptability of its graduates and the impact of its research programs.

Category‑wise recognition among Institutes of National Importance: Within the cohort of Institutes of National Importance and the IIT system, IIT Delhi is often grouped in the top tier alongside a few other longstanding IITs, based on historical prestige, breadth of programs, competitiveness of admissions, research funding, doctoral output, and influence of alumni in industry and academia.

Domain‑specific recognitions and awards: Individual departments and centers of IIT Delhi, such as those in electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, civil engineering, computer science, physics, and management studies, have earned separate recognition through discipline‑specific surveys, professional society rankings, and government evaluations, affirming high standards in teaching, research, and professional practice at the department level.

courses_and_fees.course_name: B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering (CSE)
courses_and_fees.duration: 4 Years (8 semesters, full‑time residential undergraduate program)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: For Indian nationals, tuition fees in recent years for B.Tech programs at IITs have generally been in the range of approximately INR 1–2 lakh per semester, with additional charges for hostel, mess, examination, and other institute facilities; the exact fee for IIT Delhi’s CSE program varies by academic year and category, with significant subsidies and fee waivers or scholarships available for students from economically weaker sections, reserved categories, and other eligible groups as per Government of India and institute norms.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission to the B.Tech CSE program at IIT Delhi is primarily through the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) Advanced, which is open to candidates who first qualify the national JEE Main examination conducted by the designated testing agency; aspirants must meet age limits, attempt limits, and minimum performance criteria in Class XII or equivalent examinations (with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics) as specified in the official JEE Advanced brochure, and final admission is based on All India Rank in JEE Advanced, seat allocation through JoSAA counseling, satisfaction of category‑wise cut‑off ranks (which for CSE at IIT Delhi are typically among the most competitive in the country), and fulfillment of documentation and medical fitness requirements.

courses_and_fees.duration: 4 Years (8 semesters, full‑time residential undergraduate program)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The tuition fee structure for B.Tech in Electrical Engineering at IIT Delhi is aligned with the general B.Tech fee framework of the IIT system, with semester‑wise tuition in the approximate range of INR 1–2 lakh for general category Indian students, supplemented by hostel, mess, and other institutional fees; fee concessions, scholarships, and financial aid are available based on family income, category status (SC/ST/OBC‑NCL/EWS), and other government‑mandated policies, and foreign or sponsored students may have a different fee schedule as notified by the institute each year.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Eligibility requires completion of Class XII or equivalent with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics, along with meeting the JEE Main qualification criteria followed by appearance in JEE Advanced; admission is awarded through centralized JoSAA counseling strictly on the basis of JEE Advanced All India Rank, with IIT Delhi’s Electrical Engineering branch typically demanding very high ranks due to strong demand, and candidates must satisfy category‑wise cut‑offs, reservation policies, and institute‑specific requirements such as original certificates verification and medical fitness before registration.

courses_and_fees.duration: 4 Years (8 semesters, full‑time residential undergraduate program)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: Tuition charges for the B.Tech Mechanical Engineering program follow the standard B.Tech fee pattern at IIT Delhi, generally amounting to a cumulative tuition cost in the tens of lakhs of rupees over four years for general category students before accounting for subsidies, while actual payable amounts may be substantially reduced through income‑based fee waivers, scholarships, education loans, and support schemes operated by the Government of India and the institute; students additionally pay for accommodation, food, and miscellaneous institute services.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission is through JEE Advanced after qualifying JEE Main, with academic eligibility including a recognized senior secondary qualification featuring Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics and meeting minimum aggregate percentage or rank criteria as prescribed in the JEE information brochure; JoSAA’s centralized seat allocation process assigns seats based on JEE Advanced rank and preferences, and IIT Delhi’s Mechanical Engineering program typically has competitive cut‑offs, with candidates required to comply with reservation norms, category documentation, and medical fitness standards.

courses_and_fees.duration: 4 Years (8 semesters, full‑time residential undergraduate program)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The tuition fee for B.Tech Civil Engineering at IIT Delhi is comparable to that of other B.Tech disciplines at the institute, with a per‑semester tuition component, hostel rent, mess charges, and institute fees that together constitute the total cost of education; many students benefit from merit‑cum‑means scholarships, fee waivers, or external sponsorships, and precise figures are announced annually by the institute and may differ for Indian nationals, foreign nationals, and sponsored candidates.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Candidates must qualify JEE Main and then JEE Advanced, satisfy age and attempt limits, and have completed Class XII or equivalent with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics, meeting any specified percentage criteria; admission is through JoSAA counseling based on JEE Advanced rank and category, with IIT Delhi’s Civil Engineering program attracting strong interest from students inclined towards infrastructure, structural engineering, and environmental engineering, and seats being filled in accordance with national reservation policy and institute regulations.

courses_and_fees.course_name: Integrated Dual Degree (B.Tech + M.Tech) programs (various engineering branches)
courses_and_fees.duration: 5 Years (10 semesters, integrated undergraduate + postgraduate program)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: For integrated dual degree programs, the fee structure is broadly similar to B.Tech fees on a per‑semester basis for the first four years, with tuition, hostel, and other charges announced annually, while the fifth year is treated as part of the integrated curriculum with corresponding tuition; over five years, the cumulative tuition is higher than a standalone B.Tech but typically lower than pursuing separate B.Tech and M.Tech degrees, and students may access scholarships, stipends in later years, or assistantships subject to institute policies.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission criteria are aligned with B.Tech programs and are based primarily on performance in JEE Advanced following qualification in JEE Main, with candidates listing dual degree options during JoSAA counseling; cut‑offs for specific dual degree branches vary but are often comparable to or slightly lower than corresponding four‑year B.Tech branches, and students must meet the same board examination requirements, category‑wise reservation rules, and medical fitness standards as other undergraduate entrants at IIT Delhi.

courses_and_fees.course_name: M.Tech (various specializations such as Computer Technology, Communication Systems, Mechanical Design, Structural Engineering, Power Electronics, etc.)
courses_and_fees.duration: 2 Years (4 semesters, full‑time postgraduate program; some part‑time options may also exist in select areas)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: M.Tech tuition fees at IIT Delhi are typically lower per semester than undergraduate fees for Indian nationals, reflecting government support for postgraduate technical education, with additional charges for hostel, mess, and institute services; many M.Tech students receive financial assistance in the form of monthly stipends under Teaching/Research Assistantship schemes funded by government agencies, subject to fulfilling academic performance and workload requirements, thereby offsetting the effective cost of study.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission to M.Tech programs usually requires a relevant bachelor’s degree in engineering or technology (or a related discipline) with a minimum specified percentage or CGPA, along with a valid GATE score in an appropriate paper; shortlisting and selection processes may involve cutoff GATE scores, written tests, and/or interviews conducted by departments, and sponsored candidates from industry or government organizations may be admitted under separate categories with different requirements, while reservation rules for SC/ST/OBC‑NCL/EWS/PwD categories are followed as per Government of India norms.

courses_and_fees.course_name: M.Sc (Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics and other science disciplines as offered)
courses_and_fees.duration: 2 Years (4 semesters, full‑time postgraduate science program)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: Fees for M.Sc programs at IIT Delhi are generally modest relative to engineering programs, as they are heavily subsidized public higher education offerings in the pure sciences, with students paying tuition, hostel, and miscellaneous fees at levels comparable to or lower than many private institutions; some students may also receive scholarships or fellowships funded by external agencies (such as national science fellowships) depending on their academic performance and category.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission to M.Sc programs is typically through national‑level examinations such as the Joint Admission Test for M.Sc (JAM) or other centralized tests recognized by IIT Delhi, with candidates required to hold a relevant bachelor’s degree (for example, B.Sc with appropriate subject combinations) and meet specified minimum marks or CGPA; final admission is based on all‑India rank in the entrance examination, fulfillment of category‑wise cut‑offs, document verification, and compliance with institute eligibility criteria for the specific discipline.

courses_and_fees.course_name: MBA (Master of Business Administration) – offered through Department of Management Studies (DMS), IIT Delhi
courses_and_fees.duration: 2 Years (4 semesters, full‑time residential management program)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The MBA program at IIT Delhi, offered by the Department of Management Studies, follows a fee structure similar to that of leading public management institutions in India, with total program fees typically amounting to several lakhs of rupees including tuition and other academic charges, but remaining competitive relative to many private business schools; the fee is payable in installments each semester, and students may access educational loans, institute‑level merit scholarships, or corporate sponsorships depending on their profile and opportunities.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission to the MBA program generally requires a bachelor’s degree in any discipline with a minimum percentage or CGPA as specified by DMS, along with a competitive score in a national‑level management aptitude test such as the Common Admission Test (CAT); shortlisted candidates are invited for further evaluation through group discussions, written ability tests, and personal interviews, and final selection considers multiple criteria including CAT score, academic record, work experience, diversity factors, and performance in the selection process, while reservation policies for different categories are implemented according to Government of India regulations.

courses_and_fees.course_name: Ph.D. (Doctor of Philosophy) – Engineering, Sciences, Humanities & Social Sciences, Management, and Interdisciplinary areas
courses_and_fees.duration: Typically 3–5 Years (minimum and maximum durations vary by discipline and candidate status, with full‑time and part‑time options)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: Ph.D. candidates at IIT Delhi pay semester‑wise tuition and institute fees that are generally modest compared to professional coursework programs, as doctoral education is primarily research‑oriented and frequently supported through fellowships and assistantships funded by government bodies (such as MHRD/AICTE/UGC/CSIR/DBT), industry‑sponsored projects, or institute funds; full‑time Ph.D. scholars commonly receive monthly stipends and contingency grants, significantly reducing the net cost of pursuing advanced research at the institute.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Eligibility for Ph.D. admission usually requires a master’s degree in a relevant field (M.Tech, M.E., M.Sc, M.A., MBA, or equivalent) with a minimum CGPA or percentage, or in some cases a bachelor’s degree with exceptional performance, along with evidence of research aptitude; many departments consider national‑level qualification examinations such as GATE, UGC‑NET, CSIR‑NET, or equivalent, and the admission process involves shortlisting based on academic record and test scores followed by written tests and/or interviews conducted by departmental selection committees, with separate provisions for sponsored, part‑time, and external candidates, and implementation of statutory reservation policies.

placements.description: The placement scenario at IIT Delhi is widely regarded as one of the strongest in India, with the institute attracting a large and diverse pool of recruiters across sectors such as software, information technology, core engineering, consulting, finance, analytics, product management, research and development, and fast‑growing startups, resulting in high placement rates for eligible students in both undergraduate and postgraduate programs. Over successive placement seasons, IIT Delhi has consistently reported strong average and median salary packages that reflect both the premium attached to IIT Delhi’s brand and the high demand for its graduates’ technical and analytical skills, with domestic compensation figures often ranking among the top in the country for engineering institutions. In addition to domestic offers, students at IIT Delhi regularly receive international job offers from technology firms, financial institutions, and multinational corporations, including roles in North America, Europe, and Asia‑Pacific, which significantly raise the highest package figures reported in annual statistics and illustrate the global employability of its graduates. The placement process is structured in phases, with pre‑placement talks, internships converting to pre‑placement offers (PPOs), and final interviews, and the institute’s dedicated Training and Placement Cell works closely with departments, student coordinators, and employers to schedule visits, shortlist candidates, and streamline interview logistics. Internship opportunities are an integral part of IIT Delhi’s placement ecosystem, with many students in their pre‑final year undertaking summer internships in leading companies and research labs, both in India and abroad; a significant proportion of these internships result in PPOs, which provide job security early and demonstrate employers’ confidence in the institute’s training. Placement trends over recent years show increasing interest from product‑based technology companies, high‑frequency trading firms, fintech startups, and global consulting majors, alongside stable recruitment from core engineering sectors such as construction, manufacturing, automotive, power, and telecommunications, giving students a wide choice of career paths aligned with their interests and specialization. For postgraduate students, including M.Tech, M.Sc, and MBA cohorts, the placement outcomes are also robust, with specialized roles in research and development, technical consulting, data science, product management, operations, and management consulting that leverage their advanced technical or managerial expertise. The institute’s alumni network plays a significant role in sustaining strong placement performance, as many alumni occupy senior positions in leading firms and frequently facilitate recruitment drives, internship collaborations, live projects, and industry‑academia partnerships that further enhance the placement ecosystem. Career support at IIT Delhi goes beyond the core placement season, with the institute and student bodies organizing resume‑building workshops, mock interviews, coding and case‑interview practice sessions, and sessions with alumni across sectors to help students prepare strategically for competitive selection processes. Overall, IIT Delhi’s placement record, characterized by high placement percentages, attractive salary packages, strong internship pipelines, and a broad mix of recruiting organizations, reinforces its reputation as a top destination for students seeking both high‑impact technical education and excellent career opportunities in India and abroad.
placements.highest_package: The highest packages offered in recent IIT Delhi placement seasons have typically been very high, especially for a small number of international and niche domestic roles in sectors such as global technology firms, quantitative finance, and high‑frequency trading; these headline figures, while representing only a fraction of total offers, underscore the institute’s ability to place top performers in highly competitive global roles.
placements.average_package: Average packages for core B.Tech branches and popular postgraduate programs at IIT Delhi have generally been among the highest in the country for engineering and technology institutions, reflecting sustained recruiter demand and the strong skill set of graduates; exact numeric values vary by branch, degree program, and year, but they are typically well above the national engineering graduate average, indicating a favorable return on investment for students.
major_recruiters: Various high‑frequency trading and quantitative finance firms (e.g., Tower Research, Jane Street, etc., depending on year)

facilities: Central Library: IIT Delhi maintains a large, modern central library that houses an extensive collection of printed books, reference works, technical reports, standards, bound journals, and theses across engineering, sciences, humanities, and management, complemented by access to a wide range of electronic databases, e‑journals, and e‑books; the library offers reading rooms, digital resource centers, study carrels, interlibrary loan services, and extended working hours during examination periods to support intensive academic and research activities.

Departmental Libraries and Resource Centers: In addition to the central library, many academic departments and centers maintain their own specialized libraries or resource rooms that focus on discipline‑specific literature, laboratory manuals, standards, and project reports, providing convenient access to highly relevant materials for students and researchers within the department and often serving as hubs for seminar series, reading groups, and research discussions.

Hostel Facilities: The residential campus includes multiple hostels for male and female students, each equipped with furnished rooms, common rooms with televisions and recreational facilities, internet connectivity, laundry areas, and dining halls (messes); hostel life forms a core aspect of IIT Delhi’s culture, with student‑run bodies managing many aspects of hostel governance, cultural events, inter‑hostel competitions, and peer support networks, fostering a close‑knit and collaborative community.

Dining and Mess Services: Each hostel is associated with its own mess providing daily meals, snacks, and beverages at subsidized rates, while the campus also hosts canteens, food courts, cafes, and street‑food style outlets that offer diverse cuisines and extended hours; the variety of food options supports students’ needs during late‑night study sessions and accommodates dietary preferences and constraints of a diverse student body.

Advanced Research Laboratories: IIT Delhi hosts numerous specialized research laboratories within departments such as Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Mechanical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Chemical Engineering, Physics, and others, as well as interdisciplinary centers; these labs are equipped with advanced instrumentation, computing resources, experimental setups, prototyping tools, clean rooms, and test facilities that enable cutting‑edge research in fields like microelectronics, communications, robotics, materials science, and renewable energy.

Computer and IT Infrastructure: The campus has robust computing facilities, including departmental computer labs, high‑performance computing clusters, and institute‑wide IT services that provide high‑speed wired and wireless internet connectivity, email services, and access to licensed software tools; this infrastructure supports academic coursework, large‑scale simulations, data analysis, online learning platforms, and research collaborations, and is maintained by dedicated technical staff.

Innovation and Incubation Centers: IIT Delhi has established technology business incubators, innovation centers, and entrepreneurship cells that provide co‑working spaces, mentoring, seed funding access, intellectual property support, and networking with investors and industry mentors for student and faculty startups; these facilities help transition laboratory research and student projects into viable products and companies, contributing to the broader startup ecosystem and innovation culture on campus.

Lecture Halls and Academic Buildings: The institute’s academic area comprises multiple lecture halls, classrooms, seminar rooms, and auditoria fitted with audio‑visual equipment, projectors, and, increasingly, facilities for hybrid and online teaching; academic buildings are organized around departments and centers, often including faculty offices, meeting rooms, and small discussion spaces that facilitate both formal teaching and informal academic interactions.

Sports and Recreation Facilities: IIT Delhi provides a wide range of sports infrastructure, including playgrounds for cricket, football, and hockey; courts for basketball, tennis, badminton, and volleyball; athletics tracks; a gymnasium and fitness center; and indoor sports areas for table tennis and other activities; these facilities support inter‑IIT and intra‑campus sports events and help students maintain physical fitness and work‑life balance amid demanding academic schedules.

Cultural and Student Activity Centers: Dedicated spaces such as student activity centers, auditoria, amphitheaters, and music and drama rooms support extracurricular activities including music, dance, theater, debating, photography, and literature; student clubs and societies use these facilities to organize workshops, competitions, and flagship cultural festivals like Rendezvous, which draw participation from across India and enrich campus life beyond the classroom.

Health and Medical Services: The campus typically includes a health center or hospital‑type facility that offers primary healthcare, medical consultations, basic diagnostics, and pharmacy services for students, faculty, and staff; arrangements are often in place for emergency care and referrals to larger city hospitals in Delhi, and periodic health camps and awareness programs are conducted to promote well‑being.

Residential Quarters for Faculty and Staff: IIT Delhi’s campus contains residential complexes for faculty members, staff, and their families, contributing to a vibrant on‑campus community where many academic and administrative personnel live near their workplaces; this residential character enhances accessibility, fosters informal academic interaction, and supports participation in campus events and governance beyond office hours.

Campus Transport and Accessibility: Internal roads, pedestrian pathways, and limited campus transport options help students and staff move between hostels, academic buildings, sports facilities, and other areas; the campus is located in Hauz Khas with access to public transportation options such as nearby metro stations and bus routes, facilitating connectivity with the wider Delhi region for internships, industry visits, and leisure activities.

Shops and Essential Services: Within and around the campus, various utility facilities such as small grocery shops, stationery stores, photocopy and print centers, banks or ATMs, and postal or courier services operate to meet everyday needs of students and staff, reducing the need for frequent travel outside campus for basic errands and enabling a self‑contained living and learning environment.

Green Spaces and Campus Environment: The IIT Delhi campus includes landscaped gardens, tree‑lined avenues, and open green spaces that provide pleasant surroundings for walking, outdoor study, and informal gatherings; this relatively green and quiet environment, especially notable given the institute’s urban location in Delhi, supports concentration, relaxation, and a sense of community among residents and visitors.
