university_name: Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati (IIT Guwahati)

overview.location: Amingaon, North Guwahati, Assam, on the north bank of the Brahmaputra River, about 20 km from the city centre
overview.campus_size: Approximately 700 acres (~285 hectares) of residential, fully self‑contained campus land on the north bank of the Brahmaputra River[1][7]
overview.description: Indian Institute of Technology Guwahati (IIT Guwahati) was established in 1994 as the sixth IIT in India and the first IIT in the North‑Eastern region, with academic programmes beginning in 1995 as part of the country’s push to expand high‑quality technical education across all regions.[4][5] The institute was created under the broader vision of the Government of India to promote advanced engineering, science, and design education, and it has quickly grown from a relatively young campus into a nationally and internationally recognized technological university.[4][1] Located on a scenic, self‑contained campus on the north bank of the Brahmaputra River near Guwahati, Assam, the institute is widely noted for its natural beauty, modern infrastructure, and residential environment that supports an intensive academic and research culture.[1][7] Within a short span, IIT Guwahati has built world‑class infrastructure and state‑of‑the‑art laboratories, enabling cutting‑edge research across engineering, physical sciences, biosciences, healthcare, management, and humanities.[5][8] The institute currently has multiple engineering and science departments, several interdisciplinary centres, and dedicated schools that collectively offer B.Tech., B.Des., BSc(Hons), M.Tech., M.Des., M.Sc., MBA, M.A., and Ph.D. programmes, reflecting a broad academic spectrum that goes well beyond traditional engineering.[5][4] IIT Guwahati has developed a strong reputation in areas such as data science, artificial intelligence, design, environmental science, nanotechnology, biotechnology, and healthcare technologies, and has also been recognized for unique achievements like technology transfer in domains such as animal health vaccines.[1][8] Over the years, the institute has consistently featured among the top engineering institutions in national rankings, and it has steadily advanced in global rankings, reinforcing its status as a premier Indian institution of higher education and research.[1][7] The campus culture is known for being vibrant and student‑centric, with a strong emphasis on technical clubs, cultural and sports festivals, innovation and entrepreneurship cells, and collaboration with industry and international partners, all of which foster holistic development beyond academics.[1][5] Being the only older‑generation IIT in the North‑East, IIT Guwahati plays a crucial role in meeting the aspirations of the region by attracting talent, creating local high‑skill manpower, supporting regional innovation, and acting as a hub for outreach to schools, colleges, and industry in the North‑Eastern states.[5][6] Through its combination of rigorous academics, high‑impact research, strong placement outcomes, and a distinctive setting that blends natural landscape with modern facilities, IIT Guwahati has established itself as a key pillar in India’s science and technology ecosystem and an important contributor to the country’s innovation and knowledge economy.[5][8]

rankings: NIRF 2024 Overall: Ranked 9th in India, reflecting IIT Guwahati’s strong performance across teaching, learning resources, research and professional practice, graduation outcomes, and perception metrics among peers and employers.[1]

NIRF 2024 Engineering: Ranked 7th in the Engineering category, placing IIT Guwahati among the top tier of Indian engineering institutes on parameters such as research output, academic excellence, and industry linkages.[1]

NIRF – Consistent Top 10 Presence: Over recent years, IIT Guwahati has consistently appeared in the top 10 in major NIRF categories, underlining sustained performance rather than a one‑off ranking, and signalling stable quality in academics, research, and placements.[1][5]

QS World University Rankings 2026: Ranked around =334 globally, demonstrating that IIT Guwahati has acquired significant international visibility and competitiveness among world universities, particularly in engineering and technology disciplines.[7]

QS Asia Rankings: IIT Guwahati regularly appears within the better‑ranked segment of Asian universities, indicating strong regional standing in research impact, academic reputation, and international collaborations in the Asian higher education landscape.[7][8]

Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings: IIT Guwahati is listed in THE rankings, with its profile highlighting 11 departments and multiple research centres, which illustrates its research breadth and growing international recognition as a research‑intensive institution.[8]

Subject‑level recognition in Engineering and Technology: In global rankings such as QS and THE, IIT Guwahati frequently attains higher positions in engineering and technology related subject bands compared to its overall university rank, showing particular strength in core technical disciplines.[7][8]

Research and Innovation Recognition: Ranking frameworks and external profiles commonly emphasize IIT Guwahati’s advanced research infrastructure and strong research output, which contribute significantly to indicators like citations per faculty, industry income, and patents.[5][8]

Design and Interdisciplinary Reputation: Being one of the first IITs to introduce full‑fledged design programmes (B.Des and M.Des) and to launch programs such as B.Tech in Data Science & AI has contributed to its reputation in rankings and surveys that value innovation and program diversity.[1]

National and Regional Impact: Beyond formal ranking numbers, IIT Guwahati is widely acknowledged by government agencies and academic bodies as a leading institution of national importance and a central technological hub for the North‑Eastern region, which is reflected in its standing in official profiles and governmental listings.[5][6]

courses_and_fees.course_name: B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering (CSE)
courses_and_fees.duration: 4 Years (8 Semesters, full‑time residential undergraduate program)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: For general category students, the tuition fee component for the B.Tech program is typically in the range of approximately INR 1.0–1.2 lakh per semester (subject to change as per Government of India and IIT Council regulations), with additional charges for hostel, mess, examination, and one‑time fees like admission and security deposits; fee waivers and concessions are available for SC/ST/PH students and economically weaker sections as per prevailing government norms.[4][5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission is primarily through the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) Advanced after qualifying JEE Main, conducted at the national level; candidates must have completed 10+2 (or equivalent) with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics, and must meet minimum percentage or percentile requirements specified by JoSAA and IIT Guwahati for the year; 2024 JEE Advanced closing ranks for CSE at IIT Guwahati are around All India Rank ~623 for the open category, indicating very high competition; seat allocation is done through the Joint Seat Allocation Authority (JoSAA) based on rank, category, and choice filling, and candidates must also satisfy age, attempt, and subject‑combination criteria as mandated for JEE Advanced.[1]

courses_and_fees.course_name: B.Tech in Electronics and Communication Engineering (ECE)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The tuition fee structure for B.Tech ECE is broadly similar to other B.Tech programs at IIT Guwahati, with per‑semester tuition roughly in the INR 1.0–1.2 lakh range for general category students, plus semester‑wise hostel and mess charges, institute fees, and one‑time charges; eligible students from reserved categories or low‑income backgrounds may receive fee waivers or reduced tuition as per government and institute policies.[4][5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission is via JEE Advanced, following qualification in JEE Main, and candidates must satisfy all JEE Advanced eligibility criteria including age limits, number of attempts, and minimum marks in 10+2 with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics; cutoffs vary by year and category, with the 2024 JEE Advanced cut‑off rank for ECE at IIT Guwahati around 1658 in the open category, and seat allocation occurs through centralized JoSAA counselling based on All India Rank and preference order.[1]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The aggregate tuition fee over four years for Electrical Engineering is comparable to other B.Tech disciplines at IIT Guwahati, typically amounting to several lakhs of rupees for general category students when summed across eight semesters, excluding mess and hostel charges; the institute follows centrally decided tuition norms and offers full or partial fee remissions for certain categories of students as per national guidelines.[4][5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Candidates must qualify JEE Main and then JEE Advanced, with eligibility rules regarding 10+2 subjects (Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics), year of passing, age, and number of attempts; JoSAA counselling allocates seats to IIT Guwahati’s EE program based on All India Rank in JEE Advanced, category, and choice order, with 2024 cut‑off ranks for EE around 2217 for open category, indicating high competition for limited seats.[1]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The tuition fee framework for B.Tech Mechanical Engineering mirrors that of other B.Tech programs at IIT Guwahati, with per‑semester tuition generally in the same band as CSE and ECE for general category students, along with compulsory institute, hostel, and mess fees, and refundable security deposits; financial assistance schemes, including fee waivers and scholarships, are available for eligible students.[4][5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission is through JEE Advanced on completion of JEE Main, requiring a strong performance in a highly competitive national exam, plus 10+2 (or equivalent) with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics and satisfaction of all JEE Advanced eligibility norms; JoSAA counselling determines seat allotment, and in 2024, mechanical engineering at IIT Guwahati had a closing rank around 4523 in the open category, though exact cutoffs vary annually by category and gender.[1]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: Civil Engineering students pay the same basic B.Tech tuition structure as other branches at IIT Guwahati, with total tuition over four years generally reaching several lakhs of rupees for general category students, plus hostel, mess, and miscellaneous academic charges; fee waivers for SC/ST and other eligible categories are commonly available under institutional and governmental schemes.[4][5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Entry is via JEE Advanced after qualifying JEE Main, and candidates must have studied Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics in 10+2 and meet minimum performance and eligibility norms; admission is routed through JoSAA with All India Rank in JEE Advanced as the primary selection metric, and the 2024 closing rank for civil engineering at IIT Guwahati is around 7670 in the open category, reflecting competitive but slightly more accessible entry compared to CSE and ECE.[1]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: Chemical Engineering follows the standard IIT Guwahati B.Tech fee regime, with tuition assessed each semester at rates broadly aligned with other IITs and subject to periodic revision by government and institute authorities; overall costs include tuition, hostel and mess charges, and various academic and student welfare fees, with a set of scholarships and fee concessions available for deserving students.[4][5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Prospective students must clear JEE Main and JEE Advanced, hold a 10+2 qualification with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics, and satisfy additional JEE Advanced criteria like age and attempt limits; JoSAA manages centralized counselling and seat allocation, and 2024 cut‑off data indicate that chemical engineering at IIT Guwahati closes at around rank 5363 (open category), though the exact rank fluctuates each year with demand and number of seats.[1]

courses_and_fees.course_name: B.Tech in Data Science and Artificial Intelligence
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: As a recently introduced, high‑demand program, the B.Tech in Data Science and AI is governed by the same broad fee policy as other B.Tech offerings at IIT Guwahati, with tuition around the standard IIT B.Tech level per semester, plus residential and institute charges; due to its specialized nature, students may also engage with advanced labs and computational infrastructure funded through sponsored research and centre grants without an explicit additional tuition premium.[1][5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission is via JEE Advanced with eligibility identical in structure to other B.Tech programs (JEE Main qualification, 10+2 with PCM, age and attempt constraints, minimum performance requirements), but the cut‑off rank for Data Science & AI is typically very tight due to high demand nationwide; IIT Guwahati introduced this program in response to industry and research trends, and seat allotment occurs through JoSAA based on JEE Advanced rank and candidate preferences, making it one of the most competitive branches at the institute.[1]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The B.Des program follows an IIT‑level undergraduate fee structure with semester‑wise tuition plus design‑specific studio and laboratory usage supported by institute infrastructure; total tuition across four years is comparable to B.Tech fees for general category students, and students also pay hostel, mess, and other academic charges, with reserved category fee waivers and centrally sponsored scholarships available based on eligibility.[1][5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: IIT Guwahati was the first IIT to launch full‑fledged design programs, and admission to B.Des is via the common design entrance pathway (historically including UCEED and central counselling mechanisms) rather than JEE Advanced; applicants must have completed 10+2 in any stream meeting specified criteria, qualify the relevant design entrance exam, and participate in centralized seat allocation processes, with final admission based on rank, category, and institute choice, under the regulations prevalent for the year of admission.[1]

courses_and_fees.course_name: M.Tech (Various Specializations in Engineering and Technology)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: M.Tech programs at IIT Guwahati generally have lower per‑semester tuition than undergraduate B.Tech for many categories, and total tuition over two years is typically in the range of a few lakhs of rupees for general category students, excluding hostel and mess; many M.Tech students receive stipends via GATE‑based assistantships funded by the Ministry of Education, which can effectively offset a substantial portion of living and academic expenses.[4][5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission to M.Tech is primarily through the Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) in a relevant discipline, coupled with a qualifying undergraduate degree (B.E./B.Tech or equivalent) with a minimum CPI/percentage set by the department; shortlisting may involve GATE score cutoffs, and some specializations may conduct interviews or written tests, with final selection based on GATE performance, academic record, and departmental criteria, and limited seats also offered to sponsored candidates from industry or government organizations.[5][8]

courses_and_fees.course_name: M.Sc (Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics and allied disciplines)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The total tuition fee for M.Sc programs is generally modest compared to professional programs, with per‑semester academic fees calibrated to encourage high‑quality science education and research, and overall costs including hostel and mess charges; a number of students receive financial support through institute scholarships, national fellowships, or project assistantships depending on performance and funding availability.[4][5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission to M.Sc programs is typically via national‑level entrance examinations in the sciences (such as JAM or similar tests notified by IIT Guwahati for specific years), and applicants must hold a relevant bachelor’s degree with specified minimum marks and subject prerequisites; departments may use all‑India ranks and category‑wise cutoffs to offer seats, and some may additionally consider interviews or academic records for final admission decisions.[5][8]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The MBA program at IIT Guwahati is a professional postgraduate course with a total tuition fee typically higher than conventional M.Sc programs but broadly aligned with management programs at leading public institutions in India; the fee is charged semester‑wise and covers academic delivery, library and IT usage, and other institute facilities, while hostel, mess, and miscellaneous charges are paid separately, and scholarships or educational loans are commonly used by students to support their study.[5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Candidates must hold a bachelor’s degree in any discipline with at least the minimum percentage or CGPA prescribed by the institute and are generally required to submit a valid score in a recognized management entrance exam such as CAT (or as specified in that year’s admission brochure); shortlisting is based on entrance test percentile, academic background, and sometimes work experience, followed by group discussions and personal interviews or online selection processes, with final offers extended according to composite scores and category‑wise seat availability.[5]

courses_and_fees.course_name: Ph.D. (Engineering, Sciences, Humanities, Social Sciences, Design, Management)
courses_and_fees.duration: Typically 3–5 Years (full‑time research program, with possible extension as per regulations)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: Ph.D. candidates pay relatively modest semester‑wise tuition and registration fees compared to taught programs, as doctoral education is primarily research‑oriented and often supported by fellowships; many full‑time Ph.D. scholars receive monthly stipends under schemes such as Institute Assistantship, CSIR/UGC/DBT fellowships, or project‑funded positions, which help cover living costs and tuition, and fee remission may be available for certain categories or sponsored candidates from academic and R&D organizations.[5][8]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Eligibility norms vary by department but typically require a relevant Master’s degree (or exceptional B.Tech/B.E. with high CPI for direct Ph.D.) in engineering, science, design, management, or humanities, along with qualification in national‑level exams such as GATE, NET, CSIR‑UGC, or equivalent; departments shortlist candidates based on academic record, exam scores, and research interests, and selection usually involves a written test and/or interview to assess research aptitude and fit with departmental research groups, with both full‑time regular, project‑linked, and sponsored Ph.D. categories available.[5][8]

placements.description: IIT Guwahati has built a strong and steadily improving placement record, with its graduates being recruited by leading Indian and multinational companies across technology, consulting, finance, core engineering, research, and analytics domains, reflecting the institute’s academic strength and industry relevance.[2][5] The institute’s Career Development and Placement Cell coordinates campus recruitment drives, pre‑placement talks, aptitude tests, technical interviews, and HR rounds, ensuring that students receive structured support in preparing for placements and interacting with recruiters.[2] Over the years, average and median salary packages for B.Tech and dual degree students have shown an upward trend, driven by increased participation from high‑paying recruiters in sectors such as software product development, quantitative finance, AI/ML, and consulting, as well as by the strong technical portfolio of IIT Guwahati students.[1][5] Core engineering branches also see placements with reputed public and private sector companies in manufacturing, energy, infrastructure, and engineering services, and many students opt for higher studies in leading institutions in India and abroad, which is also considered a positive graduation outcome by ranking frameworks.[5][8] The institute has seen several high domestic packages from technology and product‑based firms, often above the typical averages, and in some years international offers have significantly raised the top CTC figures, demonstrating global employer confidence in the talent pool.[1][7] Internships form an integral part of the career pipeline: many pre‑final year students secure summer internships with major companies through campus processes, and a significant proportion of these internships convert into pre‑placement offers (PPOs), thereby strengthening final placement statistics and giving students early exposure to real‑world projects.[2][5] For postgraduate programs like M.Tech, M.Des, M.Sc, and MBA, placements are aligned with specialization areas—M.Tech students often join R&D, engineering design, or technical consulting roles, MBA graduates enter management roles in operations, marketing, analytics, and finance, and design graduates join UX/UI, product design, and creative technology companies.[5][8] The institute actively engages its alumni network and industry collaborators to enhance placement opportunities, host workshops, coding contests, and hackathons, and bring in more recruiters from emerging sectors such as deep tech startups, fintech, and health tech.[1][5] Placement statistics and recruiter feedback consistently highlight the strong analytical skills, problem‑solving ability, and adaptability of IIT Guwahati graduates, and this reputation reinforces the institute’s standing as a preferred hiring destination in the North‑East and across India.[2][5] While exact package numbers vary year to year due to market conditions and recruiter mix, the overall trend reflects robust campus placement performance, with competitive average CTCs, prominent recruiters, and a broad spectrum of roles, making IIT Guwahati an attractive choice for students seeking both high‑quality education and strong career outcomes.[1][7]
placements.highest_package: Recent high packages (including a mix of domestic and occasional international offers) have reached well into the top decile of CTCs among Indian engineering campuses, with select students in computer science and allied branches receiving very high compensation from product‑based technology companies and global firms; exact figures vary annually and are typically reported in official placement reports and press releases.[1][7]
placements.average_package: Average packages for B.Tech and dual degree programs at IIT Guwahati have been consistently competitive with other leading IITs, commonly falling into the higher single‑digit to low double‑digit lakh per annum band for many branches, with CSE, ECE, and data‑oriented programs generally above the overall average and core branches maintaining solid mid‑range averages; precise numbers differ by batch and are detailed in annual placement statistics published by the institute.[1][5]

facilities: Central Library: IIT Guwahati’s central library is a major academic resource centre with a large and growing collection of books, reference volumes, journals, theses, and digital resources in engineering, science, design, management, and humanities, and it provides access to numerous online databases, e‑journals, and e‑books, along with dedicated reading rooms, computer terminals, and extended study hours to support intensive coursework and research.[5][7]

Hostels and Residential Facilities: The institute is a fully residential campus with multiple hostels for male and female students, offering well‑furnished rooms, common rooms, recreation areas, Wi‑Fi connectivity, and mess facilities; faculty and staff housing is also provided on campus, creating a closely knit academic community where students and teachers live in proximity and interact beyond classroom hours.[5][7]

Advanced Research Laboratories: IIT Guwahati has developed world‑class, state‑of‑the‑art laboratories across its departments and centres, supporting research in areas such as nanotechnology, biotechnology, advanced materials, artificial intelligence, electronics, environmental engineering, and healthcare; these labs house sophisticated scientific instruments and experimental setups, enabling both fundamental and applied research projects sponsored by national and international agencies.[5][8]

Interdisciplinary Centres and Schools: Several interdisciplinary centres and schools focus on cutting‑edge themes like data science, energy, environment, healthcare, and design, promoting collaborative research across engineering, sciences, management, and humanities, and providing specialized facilities such as high‑performance computing clusters, prototyping workshops, and experimentation platforms for multi‑disciplinary projects.[5][8]

Lecture Halls and Auditoriums: The campus includes a modern lecture hall complex with multiple large lecture theatres, each capable of seating around 250 students, and an auditorium with an approximate capacity of 1500, equipped with audio‑visual systems; these venues are used for regular teaching, workshops, national and international conferences, cultural events, and institute‑wide ceremonies.[7]

Computer and IT Infrastructure: IIT Guwahati maintains strong IT infrastructure with campus‑wide networking, high‑speed internet connectivity, computer centres, departmental computing labs, and specialized clusters for research; students and faculty have access to software tools and platforms needed for programming, data analysis, simulation, and design, supporting both academic and extracurricular technical activities.[5][7]

Sports and Recreation Facilities: The institute provides extensive sports infrastructure including outdoor fields for cricket, football, and athletics, courts for basketball, volleyball, tennis, and badminton, as well as indoor sports facilities and gymnasiums; regular sports events, inter‑hostel tournaments, and fitness programs encourage physical well‑being and a healthy work‑life balance among students.[5][7]

Cultural and Student Activity Spaces: Multiple open‑air and indoor venues exist for cultural clubs, music, dance, drama, literary societies, and student‑run bodies; large‑scale student festivals and technical events make use of these facilities, and dedicated rooms for clubs foster a vibrant campus life that supports creativity, leadership, and teamwork beyond academics.[1][5]

Design and Innovation Studios: As one of the first IITs with full‑fledged design programs, IIT Guwahati hosts specialized studios, design labs, maker spaces, and prototyping workshops in its Department of Design and related centres, equipped with tools for model making, digital fabrication, visualization, and user‑experience research, thereby supporting design education and product innovation.[1][5]

Healthcare and Medical Centre: A campus health centre staffed with medical practitioners and support personnel provides primary healthcare services to students, staff, and faculty, including outpatient care, basic diagnostics, and emergency response support; the institute also maintains arrangements with external hospitals in the city for advanced medical treatment when required.[5]

Cafeterias, Messes, and Shopping Amenities: Each hostel has its own mess facility offering regular meals, and there are additional canteens and cafeterias across campus that serve a variety of cuisines and snacks; essential shopping outlets and small convenience stores within campus provide daily necessities, reducing the need for frequent travel to the city for routine requirements.[5][7]

Transportation and Connectivity: The campus is located around 20 km from the heart of Guwahati city and is connected via road, with institute‑managed transportation and local public transport options facilitating movement between campus and city; internal campus roads, pedestrian paths, and cycling‑friendly routes enable easy access to academic buildings, hostels, and facilities.[7]

Library and Digital Learning Support: In addition to physical collections, the library and IT services enable remote access to subscribed e‑resources, online learning platforms, digital repositories, and lecture recording systems, which support self‑paced learning, blended pedagogy, and extended research work from hostel rooms and faculty offices.[5][7]

Industry Interaction and Incubation Facilities: Through its centres and dedicated office for sponsored research and industrial consultancy, IIT Guwahati offers infrastructure and administrative support for industry‑sponsored projects, consultancy assignments, and startup incubation, including office space, meeting rooms, and in some cases specialized labs for early‑stage product development.[5][8]

Campus Environment and Green Spaces: The IIT Guwahati campus is known for its picturesque natural surroundings, with green areas, water bodies, and an environmentally conscious layout that integrates academic and residential buildings into the landscape; this environment provides a calm and aesthetically pleasing setting conducive to study, reflection, and creative work.[1][7]

overview.description: Indian Institute of Technology Hyderabad (IIT Hyderabad or IITH) is a premier public technical and research university established in 2008 by the Ministry of Education, Government of India, as part of the expansion of the IIT system to strengthen high‑quality engineering education and research in the country.[2][5] It initially operated from a temporary campus in Hyderabad before shifting in 2015 to its modern, eco‑conscious permanent campus at Kandi, spanning nearly 600 acres with academic blocks, hostels, research facilities, and recreational spaces integrated into a master‑planned layout.[2][7] The institute was developed with significant technical and financial collaboration from the Government of Japan, which helped shape its infrastructure, research ethos, and early academic collaborations.[2] Despite being a relatively young IIT, IIT Hyderabad has rapidly built a strong reputation and is consistently ranked among the top engineering institutes in India in the NIRF rankings, often featuring in the top 10 for engineering and among the leading research institutions nationally.[4][5][6] Internationally, IITH has established a visible presence through its improving QS World University Rankings and Times Higher Education rankings, where it is recognized as one of India’s notable engineering-focused universities with growing global research output.[4][7] The institute emphasizes a "learning by doing" and innovation-driven academic model, reflected in its project-based curriculum, BUILD and BHARATI initiatives, and a strong culture of undergraduate and postgraduate research.[5] Campus life at IIT Hyderabad is characterized by a residential setup where students, faculty, and staff live in close proximity, supported by modern hostels, sports facilities, clubs, and cultural festivals that encourage holistic development beyond academics.[5][7] The institute has invested heavily in advanced laboratories, interdisciplinary centers, and incubation spaces, which have led to thousands of Scopus-indexed publications and hundreds of patents and startups over a short span of time.[4][6] With programs ranging from traditional B.Tech disciplines to niche areas like Artificial Intelligence, Biomedical Engineering, Techno‑Entrepreneurship, and Design, IITH functions as a hub for cutting‑edge education tailored to emerging industry and societal needs.[4][5] Owing to its rapid growth, strong placement records, vibrant research ecosystem, and entrepreneurial culture, IIT Hyderabad is widely regarded as one of the fastest‑rising second‑generation IITs and an important pillar in India’s broader strategy to build world‑class STEM institutions.[4][5][6]

rankings: NIRF 2025 Engineering: Ranked 7th among engineering institutes in India, reflecting strong performance in teaching, learning resources, research output, graduation outcomes, and perception metrics.[6]
NIRF 2025 Innovation: Ranked 6th in the Innovation category, highlighting the institute’s focus on patents, startups, technology transfer, and industry-linked research.[6]

NIRF (recent years) Overall: Consistently placed around 14th–15th in the overall institutional rankings in India, indicating that IITH is competitive even when evaluated alongside multidisciplinary universities and research institutes.[4][6]

NIRF (recent years) Engineering Top‑10: IITH has been "consistently ranked in the top 10 institutes in India for Engineering" according to official institute information, showing sustained excellence rather than a one‑off performance.[5]

QS World University Rankings 2026: Placed around the band of #=664 globally, showing that IIT Hyderabad has secured an identifiable presence in global rankings within less than two decades of its establishment.[4]

QS World Rankings – India Technical Institutes: Counted within the "Top‑7 ranks among technical institutes from India" in QS world rankings, which situates IITH among the leading Indian tech institutions on international parameters.[4]

QS World Rankings – Top 600 Club (earlier editions): Earlier QS cycles placed IIT Hyderabad within or near the "Top 600" globally, and the institute highlights its entry into and retention near this global bracket as a milestone for a young IIT.[4]

National research profile: Cited among the "Top‑12 Research Institutes in the country" in certain NIRF/research‑oriented classifications, underlining the quality and volume of sponsored research, publications, and PhD training.[4][6]

Research output: Approximately 7,500+ Scopus‑indexed publications over about 14 years, which, though not a formal ranking, is used by several ranking frameworks as an indicator of the institute’s research strength and impact.[4]

Innovation & entrepreneurship metrics: Over 630+ patents filed and 335+ startups supported, helping IIT Hyderabad feature strongly in innovation-oriented rankings and government innovation indices that track commercialization and startup ecosystems.[6]

courses_and_fees.course_name: B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering (CSE)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: For general/OBCEWS students, the tuition fee is typically in the range of ₹1–2 lakh per semester, with total tuition over four years often around ₹8–10 lakh, excluding hostel, mess, and other charges; substantial tuition waivers or zero tuition are available for SC/ST and many economically weaker-category students as per Government of India and IIT norms, and the institute also offers scholarships, fee remissions, and education loan facilitation for eligible students.[5][6]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission is through JEE (Main) followed by JEE (Advanced), with candidates required to qualify JEE (Advanced) in the relevant year and secure a competitive All India Rank that meets the JoSAA counseling cut-offs for the CSE program at IIT Hyderabad; applicants must have completed Class 12 or equivalent with Physics, Mathematics, and a recognized language/other subjects, satisfying minimum percentage or percentile criteria as prescribed for JEE (Advanced) eligibility, and seat allotment is strictly merit-based with category-wise opening and closing ranks that are typically among the highest at IITH due to the popularity and placement outcomes of CSE.

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The tuition fee structure is similar to other B.Tech programs, usually around ₹1–2 lakh per semester for general category students, amounting to an estimated ₹8–10 lakh for the full course duration, with additional expenses for hostel, mess, and personal costs; statutory tuition waivers for SC/ST students and income-based fee waivers or remissions for economically weaker students are available, along with institutional and external scholarships for meritorious and needy candidates.[4][5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission is based on performance in JEE (Advanced) after qualifying JEE (Main), with candidates needing to rank within the relatively tight cut-off range for the AI branch at IIT Hyderabad, which is one of the sought‑after new‑age programs; aspirants must have completed higher secondary education (10+2) with Mathematics and Physics as core subjects and must satisfy JEE (Advanced) eligibility criteria, and final branch allocation is done through centralized JoSAA counseling on the basis of category-wise All India Rank and seat availability.

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The tuition fee is aligned with other B.Tech programs at IIT Hyderabad, approximating ₹1–2 lakh per semester for general/OBCEWS students, leading to an overall tuition estimate of ₹8–10 lakh over four years, while SC/ST students are generally exempt from tuition as per government norms; hostel, mess, and one‑time charges are additional, and students can avail need‑based financial assistance, national scholarships, and institute-level grants subject to eligibility and availability.[4][5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Selection is through JEE (Advanced) via JoSAA counseling, where candidates who have cleared JEE (Main) and JEE (Advanced) with the required merit can opt for the Biomedical Engineering branch at IIT Hyderabad; applicants must have studied Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics at the 10+2 level and satisfy the age, attempt, and percentage criteria prescribed by the JEE organizing authorities, and the closing ranks for this branch fall within competitive ranges reflecting its niche and interdisciplinary appeal.

courses_and_fees.course_name: B.Tech in Electrical Engineering / Electronics-related disciplines
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The indicative tuition fee is around ₹1–2 lakh per semester for general category students, with a cumulative tuition outlay of roughly ₹8–10 lakh over the full course, supplemented by hostel, mess, and other institutional fees; SC/ST students benefit from tuition exemptions as per central government policy, and there are scholarships, fee waivers, and assistantships (in later years via research/industry projects) that can reduce the net cost for deserving students.[5][6]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission occurs via JEE (Advanced) based on All India Rank, with counseling and seat allocation handled through JoSAA; candidates must complete 10+2 with Physics, Mathematics, and typically Chemistry or an equivalent science subject, meet JEE eligibility criteria, and secure a rank within the opening and closing ranges announced for the Electrical/ECE-related B.Tech programs at IIT Hyderabad, which are generally in high demand due to robust placement outcomes and research opportunities.

courses_and_fees.course_name: M.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering / allied specializations
courses_and_fees.duration: 2 Years (4 Semesters, full-time; some specializations may offer flexible or sponsored tracks)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: Tuition fees for M.Tech are typically lower per semester than for B.Tech, and for GATE-qualified students admitted to regular full-time programs, tuition may be around a few tens of thousands of rupees per semester, with total tuition for two years commonly lying in the range of ₹1–2 lakh; many students receive monthly stipends through GATE-based MHRD/Ministry scholarships, and sponsored/part-time candidates may follow different fee structures as per institute and funding agency norms.[5][6]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Candidates must possess a relevant B.E./B.Tech (or equivalent) degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or closely related disciplines with a minimum CGPA/percentage prescribed by IIT Hyderabad and must typically have a valid GATE score in CS or another acceptable paper, with shortlisting and admission based on GATE score, academic performance, and sometimes departmental tests or interviews; certain industry-oriented or sponsored M.Tech options may admit experienced professionals using GATE or other criteria, as notified in the institute’s admission brochure.

courses_and_fees.course_name: M.Tech in Artificial Intelligence / Data Science / AI-related fields
courses_and_fees.duration: 2 Years (4 Semesters, full-time with possible specialization tracks)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The tuition fee is generally in a similar band as other M.Tech programs, with per-semester tuition on the order of tens of thousands of rupees for regular GATE-based admissions, and an overall tuition of roughly ₹1–2 lakh across the two-year duration, excluding hostel and living expenses; qualified students often receive GATE-based stipends that partially offset costs, and special executive or online variants of data-centric programs may carry different fee structures reflecting their modular or industry-focused design.[4][5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Applicants must hold a relevant undergraduate degree in engineering or technology, such as CSE, ECE, EE, or allied areas, and usually require a valid GATE score in CS, EC, EE, or other specified papers according to the program brochure, with shortlisting based on GATE performance and further evaluation via interviews or written tests where applicable; some industry-oriented or executive-style offerings in data science or AI may admit candidates with significant work experience under different selection criteria, such as academic record, statement of purpose, and professional track record.

courses_and_fees.course_name: M.Tech in Biomedical Engineering / allied interdisciplinary programs
courses_and_fees.duration: 2 Years (4 Semesters, full-time, research and project intensive)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The tuition fee falls within the usual M.Tech range at IIT Hyderabad, around a few tens of thousands of rupees per semester for regular seats, culminating in approximately ₹1–2 lakh total tuition over the program, with additional hostel and thesis-related expenses; GATE-qualified students are eligible for stipends subject to government rules, and collaborative or sponsored research projects may provide financial support or contingency grants for thesis work.[4][5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission generally requires a B.E./B.Tech or equivalent degree in Biomedical Engineering, Electronics, Electrical, Mechanical, Biotechnology, Instrumentation, or related disciplines, along with a valid GATE score in appropriate papers such as BM, EC, EE, IN, ME, or BT, as specified by the department; selection is typically based on GATE score, academic background, and in some cases departmental interviews or technical assessments that evaluate the candidate’s aptitude for interdisciplinary biomedical research.

courses_and_fees.course_name: M.Tech in Techno-Entrepreneurship / industry-oriented M.Tech programs
courses_and_fees.duration: 2 Years (4 Semesters, with possible flexible or modular structures depending on track)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: These specialized, often industry-linked M.Tech programs may have fee structures that differ slightly from standard GATE-linked M.Tech offerings, sometimes reflecting additional components like innovation labs, incubation support, or executive-style delivery; in many cases, tuition lies around the low‑to‑mid lakh range for the full program, though exact figures vary by cohort and mode (regular, sponsored, executive), and students may also access seed support or grants through entrepreneurship cells and incubation schemes rather than conventional stipends.[4][5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Eligibility typically includes a relevant engineering or technology bachelor’s degree with a minimum prescribed CGPA/percentage, and for regular tracks, a valid GATE score in an appropriate discipline, while certain techno‑entrepreneurship or industry-oriented variants might consider applicants based on academic merit plus work experience, statement of purpose, and interviews; these programs look for candidates interested in innovation, startups, and product development, and may require presentation of preliminary ideas or portfolios during the selection process.

courses_and_fees.course_name: M.Sc / M.S (Research) in Sciences and Interdisciplinary Areas
courses_and_fees.duration: 2 Years for M.Sc (coursework-focused) and typically 2–3 Years for M.S (research-focused), full-time
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: Tuition for science and research programs is usually moderate compared to professional programs, with per-semester tuition commonly in the lower tens of thousands of rupees and a total estimated tuition of roughly ₹1–1.5 lakh over the full duration for many tracks, excluding hostel and laboratory expenses; eligible students often receive fellowships or stipends from CSIR, UGC, DST, or project grants, particularly in the case of M.S (Research) candidates working on funded projects.[5][6]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: For M.Sc, candidates generally require a bachelor’s degree in the relevant science discipline (such as Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics, or allied fields) and must qualify through national-level exams or institute-specific criteria, sometimes including tests like JAM as per the admission brochure; for M.S (Research), applicants typically need a relevant B.Tech/B.E. or M.Sc degree, a strong academic record, and in many cases a valid GATE or equivalent qualification, with selection based on academic performance and interviews that assess research potential and alignment with faculty interests.

courses_and_fees.course_name: Ph.D. Programs across Engineering, Sciences, Design, and Liberal Arts
courses_and_fees.duration: Typically 4–5 Years full-time, with possible variation based on discipline, research progress, and prior qualifications
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: Ph.D. tuition fees are generally modest, with low per-semester tuition for full-time scholars; the major financial component is usually covered through fellowships or assistantships, as most Ph.D. students receive monthly stipends from government schemes (e.g., Institute fellowships, CSIR/UGC, DST) or sponsored projects, effectively making the net tuition burden limited while providing a sustained stipend for living expenses, contingent on satisfactory academic and research performance.[5][6]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Applicants must hold a relevant Master’s degree (or exceptional B.Tech/B.E. with high CGPA in some direct Ph.D. tracks) in engineering, sciences, design, or liberal arts, along with a strong academic record and, for most categories, a valid qualification such as GATE, UGC-NET, CSIR-NET, or equivalent national fellowship; selection is based on shortlisting from the application pool followed by written tests and interviews conducted by departments, where research proposal fit, prior project work, publications, and letters of recommendation play an important role in the final admission decision.

placements.description: The placement scenario at IIT Hyderabad has evolved rapidly, with the institute now achieving outcomes comparable to many of the older IITs across core engineering, software, analytics, and emerging technology sectors.[4][5][6] Over the years, the number of recruiting companies and offers has steadily grown, supported by a dedicated placement office that coordinates pre-placement talks, internship pipelines, and campus recruitment drives with both Indian and international firms.[5][6] Annual campus recruitment typically sees a strong presence from software and IT majors, semiconductor and electronics companies, consulting firms, R&D organizations, and fast-growing startups, ensuring diverse roles for graduates from different departments.[4][6] B.Tech programs in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, and other computing-related disciplines tend to attract some of the highest-paying offers, while core branches like Electrical, Mechanical, Civil, Chemical, and Biomedical also record solid placement rates with reputed companies in their domains.[4][5] The overall compensation trends indicate a healthy mix of high-end packages from global and top-tier Indian technology firms alongside stable, mid-range offers from established engineering, manufacturing, and consulting recruiters, helping maintain a good median salary for the graduating batch.[4][6] Internships play a central role in the placement ecosystem, with many students completing summer internships at leading companies or research labs, often converting these into pre-placement offers (PPOs) that secure job positions well before the final placement season.[5][6] The institute’s emphasis on research and hands-on learning has also translated into strong opportunities in R&D and product-development roles, including positions in chip design, embedded systems, AI/ML engineering, data science, and advanced materials.[4][6] Entrepreneurship and startup pathways are actively encouraged, with some students opting to work on their own ventures incubated within IITH’s startup ecosystem instead of or alongside conventional placement offers, a trend that contributes indirectly to the institute’s placement and innovation profile.[4][6] Over time, average and median CTC figures at IIT Hyderabad have generally shown an upward trajectory, driven by the rising demand for graduates skilled in AI, data science, VLSI, and other high-growth areas, as well as the institute’s growing brand recognition among recruiters.[4][6] Beyond immediate job placements, the training and career guidance ecosystem — including soft-skills training, mock interviews, mentoring by alumni, and domain-specific workshops — helps students prepare for varied career paths such as higher studies in top global universities, research careers, and leadership roles in industry.[5][6]
placements.highest_package: Recent placement cycles have seen some of the top offers from leading technology and product companies reach very high CTC levels (often in the top decile among IITs), with select international or niche roles significantly exceeding the typical domestic package range, though exact figures vary year to year and by domain.[4][6]
placements.average_package: The average cost-to-company (CTC) for B.Tech graduates generally lies in a strong mid-to-upper range compared with peer institutes, with computing and electronics branches registering higher averages and core branches maintaining competitive figures that have risen steadily as more recruiters and diversified roles have been added.[4][6]

facilities: Central Library: IIT Hyderabad maintains a central library that supports engineering, sciences, design, and humanities with a growing collection of physical books, technical reports, theses, and an extensive range of e‑resources including e‑journals, databases, standards, and conference proceedings; the library provides digital access, quiet reading spaces, group-study rooms, and extended hours during exam periods to support intensive academic and research activities.[5][7]

Research Laboratories and Advanced R&D Infrastructure: The campus hosts specialized laboratories in areas such as artificial intelligence, data science, VLSI and microelectronics, materials science, additive manufacturing, biomedical engineering, communications, and robotics, many of which are equipped with modern instrumentation, clean-room environments, high-performance computing clusters, and dedicated project spaces to facilitate cutting-edge research and sponsored projects.[4][5][6]

Hostels and Residential Facilities: IIT Hyderabad is a fully residential campus with multiple hostel blocks for male and female students, offering furnished rooms, internet connectivity, common rooms, recreational areas, and mess facilities; the residential design encourages peer learning and community living, and there are on-campus residences for faculty and staff that help build an integrated academic community.[5][7]

Classrooms, Lecture Halls, and Auditoriums: The academic zone includes well-equipped classrooms, lecture theatres, and seminar halls with modern audio-visual systems, projection, and sometimes lecture capture capabilities, enabling interactive teaching, guest lectures, workshops, and conferences; larger auditoriums and multi-purpose halls host institute events, cultural festivals, convocations, and major academic gatherings.[5][7]

Computing and IT Infrastructure: The institute offers robust IT services including campus-wide high-speed network connectivity, wireless internet access in academic and hostel areas, computer labs for different departments, and servers for course management and research; high-performance computing resources support data-intensive and simulation-based research in areas like AI, materials, CFD, and computational biology.[4][5][6]

Innovation, Incubation, and Startup Support (Research Park, Incubators): IIT Hyderabad has dedicated incubation spaces and a research park with large floor areas (around 1.5 lakh square feet each for incubation and research park activities) to host startups, industry labs, and collaborative projects; these facilities provide office space, mentoring, prototyping support, access to labs, and networking opportunities, underpinning the institute’s strong startup culture.[4][6]

Workshops and Maker Spaces: Departments maintain mechanical, electrical, and interdisciplinary workshops with machine tools, fabrication equipment, electronics benches, 3D printers, and prototyping resources that support the "learning by doing" philosophy; these spaces are crucial for course projects, capstone designs, hackathons, and student competition teams building robots, vehicles, or other engineering prototypes.[5][6]

Sports and Recreational Facilities: The campus includes open and indoor sports facilities such as grounds and courts for cricket, football, basketball, volleyball, and badminton, along with areas for athletics and indoor games; students can participate in inter-IIT tournaments, intramural leagues, and fitness activities that contribute to a balanced campus life.[5][7]

Cultural, Co-curricular, and Student Activity Spaces: Various clubs and student bodies operate from designated rooms and common spaces, organizing activities in music, drama, dance, literature, photography, coding, robotics, and entrepreneurship; the campus hosts cultural and technical fests, talks, and competitions that leverage auditoriums, open-air stages, and student centers for large-scale events.[5][7]

Cafeterias, Messes, and Food Courts: Multiple messes attached to hostels and central dining facilities provide vegetarian and non-vegetarian meals, with menus decided often in consultation with student bodies; additional canteens and cafes across the campus serve snacks and beverages, offering informal spaces for social interaction and group discussions beyond classrooms.[5][7]

Health Centre and Wellness Services: A campus health centre staffed with medical professionals provides primary healthcare services, emergency care, and basic diagnostics for students, faculty, and staff; wellness initiatives may include counselling support, mental health awareness programs, and collaborations with specialized hospitals in Hyderabad for advanced medical treatment when required.[5][7]

Transportation and Internal Mobility: The campus layout, spread over more than 500 acres, is supported by internal roads, walkways, and often shuttle or bus services connecting hostel zones with academic and administrative buildings; its proximity to the Outer Ring Road and NH‑65 facilitates connectivity to Hyderabad city, airports, and major transport hubs for commuting guests, recruiters, and visitors.[2][7]

Administrative and Student Support Services: Dedicated offices manage academic administration, finance, scholarships, international relations, industry relations, career services, and hostel administration, providing structured support for student life-cycle events from admission to graduation; student grievance cells, anti-ragging committees, and mentorship frameworks help maintain a safe and inclusive campus environment.[5][6]

Design and Liberal Arts Spaces: In line with its unique blend of engineering, design, and liberal arts, IIT Hyderabad houses studios, design labs, and creative spaces tailored to design and humanities programs, where students can work on visual communication, product design, and interdisciplinary projects combining technology with social science and artistic perspectives.[4][5]

Green and Sustainable Campus Features: The Kandi campus incorporates environmentally conscious planning with green spaces, efficient water and energy management, and an emphasis on sustainable building practices, aligning with modern campus design principles and providing a pleasant, low‑congestion environment for academic and residential life.[2][7]

overview.campus_size: Approximately 430 hectares (around 1050+ acres) of fully residential, self-contained campus on the Grand Trunk Road near Kalyanpur, Kanpur district.[1][3]
overview.description: Indian Institute of Technology Kanpur (IIT Kanpur) is a premier public institute of technology established in 1959, and is recognized as an Institute of National Importance by the Government of India under the Institutes of Technology Act.[1][5] It began operations in late 1959 on the borrowed premises of Harcourt Butler Technological Institute with around 100 students and a small faculty, and later moved in 1963 to its present, meticulously planned campus on the Grand Trunk Road near Kalyanpur in Kanpur district.[1][2] The campus was designed by renowned architect Achyut Kanvinde and is known for its modernist layout, generous green spaces, and a design philosophy aimed at environmental openness, ease of movement, and strong interconnection among academic, residential, and recreational zones.[1] During its formative decade, IIT Kanpur was uniquely shaped by the Kanpur Indo-American Programme (KIAP), under which a consortium of nine leading US universities—including MIT, Caltech, UC Berkeley, Princeton, Carnegie Mellon, University of Michigan, Ohio State, Case Western Reserve, and Purdue—helped set up advanced laboratories, curricula, and research culture.[1][4] Under this Indo-American collaboration, IIT Kanpur became one of the first institutions in India to establish a strong research-driven engineering and science ecosystem, laying the foundation for its later reputation as a global center of excellence in technology and innovation.[1][3] IIT Kanpur is historically significant for introducing one of the earliest formal Computer Science education programs in India, starting computer courses as early as 1963 on an IBM 1620 and launching independent M.Tech and PhD programs in Computer Science and Engineering by 1971, which later evolved into a full-fledged department.[1] Over the decades, the institute has consistently ranked among the top engineering institutions in India and holds a strong position in global rankings, reflecting its high-quality teaching, cutting-edge research, and robust industry linkages.[3] Its alumni and faculty have been recognized with numerous national and international honors, including multiple Padma awards and Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Prizes, underlining the institute’s impact on science, technology, policy, and entrepreneurship in India.[1] The campus culture at IIT Kanpur is known for its intense academic rigor balanced with a vibrant student life that includes major technical, cultural, and entrepreneurial festivals such as Techkriti and Antaragni, along with a strong tradition of clubs, student-led initiatives, and competitive sports.[1][3] In recent years, IIT Kanpur has expanded its interdisciplinary footprint through new centers of excellence, incubation programs like the Startup Innovation and Incubation Centre (SIIC), and major national missions in areas such as advanced materials, defense technologies, clean energy, and digital innovation, reinforcing its role as a key driver of India’s scientific and technological advancement.[3]

Reputation among employers and research organizations: Consistently reported by national media and industry surveys as a preferred recruitment and collaboration destination for top technology firms, R&D labs, and startups, owing to its rigorous curriculum, strong fundamental training, and active innovation ecosystem (inferred from its strong placement records and QS employer reputation indicator).[3]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The tuition structure is aligned with the general B.Tech fee regime at IIT Kanpur and other centrally funded IITs, with per-semester tuition on the order of INR 1–2 lakh for general category students, along with hostel, mess, and one-time charges; fee waivers or subsidies may apply for certain economically weaker categories as per Government of India and IIT Kanpur policies; actual payable amounts, including refundable deposits and other components, are published in the institute’s official fee schedules and are subject to periodic revision.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Candidates must qualify JEE Advanced after clearing JEE Main and meet the eligibility norms of the IIT system, including passing the 10+2 (or equivalent) examination with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics and meeting the prescribed percentage or rank criteria; seat allocation in Electrical Engineering at IIT Kanpur is done through JoSAA counseling based on JEE Advanced AIR and category-specific opening and closing ranks, which historically are among the top for core engineering branches; reservation policies for SC, ST, OBC-NCL, EWS, and PwD candidates apply as per Government of India rules.

placements.description: IIT Kanpur has a long-standing reputation for strong campus placements, with its graduates being sought after by leading technology companies, consulting firms, core engineering enterprises, financial institutions, and research organizations, both in India and abroad.[3] The institute’s placement season is highly structured, beginning with internships and pre-placement offers for pre-final year students and culminating in a multi-phase recruitment drive where hundreds of organizations participate through on-campus and virtual modes coordinated by the institute’s Career Development and Placement Cell.[3] Trends over recent years indicate that IIT Kanpur consistently achieves very high placement percentages for B.Tech and dual-degree programs in high-demand branches such as Computer Science, Electrical, and Mathematics & Computing, while core branches like Mechanical, Civil, and Chemical also record robust outcomes with a mix of core and non-core roles.[3] According to recent media reports, the 2025–26 placement season opened with a record-breaking Day 1 performance, where IIT Kanpur received about 672 job offers on the first day alone, representing roughly a 16% increase compared to the previous year and underscoring the growing employer interest in its students.[8] Over the years, domestic average salary packages for top branches have typically been well into double-digit lakhs per annum for B.Tech students, with median values reflecting steady improvement as more high-end technology, product, and finance roles come to campus (exact numerical averages vary year by year and are usually published by the institute in its official placement reports).[3][8] In addition to domestic roles, a sizeable number of international offers—especially for software engineering, quantitative finance, and research positions—are regularly reported, with some students securing very high-valued compensation packages when converted to Indian rupees, though the institute and media often differentiate between cost-of-living-adjusted international CTCs and Indian offers.[3][8] Internship opportunities are also a major strength, with pre-final year students interning at top companies, overseas research labs, and universities, often through dedicated internship drives and institute-facilitated programs, which frequently convert to pre-placement offers and significantly de-risk the final placement process.[3] The presence of a strong research and startup ecosystem through SIIC and various Centers of Excellence means that some students opt for research positions, higher studies, or entrepreneurial ventures rather than traditional corporate roles, diversifying the placement outcomes beyond pure salary statistics.[3] In recent years, IIT Kanpur has also enhanced engagement with public sector units, government organizations, and mission-mode national projects, enabling interested students to take up impactful roles in policy, infrastructure, and national security-related domains. Overall, the placement scenario at IIT Kanpur is characterized by high offer volumes, rising average CTCs over time, broad sectoral representation, and strong recruiter loyalty, reaffirming the institute’s standing as a preferred hiring destination in India’s technology and innovation landscape.[3][8]
placements.highest_package: Recent placement drives have reported some of the highest cost-to-company (CTC) figures as very high-value international offers in technology and quantitative roles, with annual packages (on a CTC basis and converted to INR) reaching into the crore-plus range, though such figures may represent only a small number of offers and include stock options and benefits; exact numerical highest packages for the latest season are typically released by IIT Kanpur’s placement cell or via official press notes and should be consulted for precise amounts.[3][8]
placements.average_package: Average packages for B.Tech and dual-degree programs at IIT Kanpur in recent years have generally fallen into a healthy double-digit lakh per annum band for domestic offers, with branch-wise averages for CSE and related disciplines often significantly exceeding the institute-wide average; M.Tech, M.Sc, and MBA programs also report competitive average CTCs aligned with their respective industry sectors, and year-on-year trends indicate a gradual upward trajectory in both mean and median compensation figures (exact rupee values are documented in institute placement reports and may change each season).[3][8]

facilities: PK Kelkar Central Library: A large, modern central library named after IIT Kanpur’s first director, housing a vast collection of books, journals, technical reports, theses, e-resources, and digital databases across engineering, science, humanities, and management; it offers spacious reading halls, digital catalog access, online journal subscriptions, and extended hours to support intensive academic and research work.[1]

Extensive Hostel System: A network of multiple boys’ and girls’ hostels providing residential accommodation to a large proportion of the more than 10,000-strong student body, with facilities such as furnished rooms, common rooms, TV rooms, indoor games, Wi-Fi or wired internet, and messes serving structured meal plans, aiming to create a cohesive residential and learning community on campus.[2]

Advanced Research Laboratories: State-of-the-art research labs spread across departments and interdisciplinary centers, including specialized facilities in microelectronics, nanotechnology, materials science, robotics, computer science, data science, and environmental engineering, many of which were originally set up and expanded with technical support from the Kanpur Indo-American Programme and have since evolved into nationally significant research hubs.[1][3][4]

National Wind Tunnel Facility (NWTF): A major national facility hosted at IIT Kanpur that provides advanced wind tunnel testing capabilities for aerospace, automotive, civil, and defense applications, supporting both academic research and industry-sponsored projects and making the institute a key player in aerodynamics and flight-related experimentation at the national level.[3]

Flight Laboratory with Functional Runway: A modern flight laboratory featuring a functional airstrip and aviation equipment that enables hands-on training, experiments, and demonstrations in aerodynamics, flight mechanics, and aerospace engineering, positioning IIT Kanpur uniquely among Indian academic institutions with such on-campus aviation infrastructure.[3]

High-Performance Computing and Supercomputing Resources: IIT Kanpur historically installed one of the earliest supercomputers in an Indian academic institution and continues to operate high-performance computing (HPC) clusters to support computational research in areas such as fluid dynamics, materials modeling, climate science, and data-intensive machine learning, accessible to faculty and students under structured allocation policies.[3]

Startup Innovation and Incubation Centre (SIIC): A dedicated innovation and incubation ecosystem hosting dozens of technology startups and spin-offs, offering office space, labs, mentorship, seed funding access, IP support, and industry connect; more than 60+ startups have graduated from SIIC and several dozen remain actively incubated, contributing to job creation and commercialization of IIT Kanpur’s research.[3]

Lecture Halls and Academic Complexes: Multiple centrally air-conditioned lecture halls, classrooms, and department buildings equipped with modern teaching aids such as digital projectors, audio systems, and smart boards, complemented by smaller tutorial rooms, seminar rooms, and faculty offices that foster interactive pedagogy and close student–faculty engagement.[1][3]

Central Academic and Administrative Facilities: Administrative buildings, academic offices, and service centers that coordinate academic programs, research administration, sponsored projects, student services, and external collaborations, providing the institutional backbone for the institute’s complex multi-departmental operations.[1][4]

Sports and Recreation Infrastructure: A wide range of sports facilities including large playgrounds for cricket, football, hockey, and athletics, indoor courts for badminton and squash, tennis courts, gymnasiums, and likely swimming and fitness centers, supporting both competitive sports teams and recreational activities that are integral to student life (inferred from typical large IIT campus infrastructure and IIT Kanpur’s residential campus nature).

Student Activity Centers and Clubs: Dedicated spaces for cultural, technical, and hobby clubs that host activities related to music, dance, drama, photography, robotics, coding, literary arts, and entrepreneurship, along with venues and infrastructure for large-scale festivals such as Techkriti (technical festival) and Antaragni (cultural festival), which attract national-level participation.[1][3]

Health Centre and Medical Services: An on-campus health center providing primary medical care, emergency services, and referral support to students, faculty, and staff, often supplemented by tie-ups with city hospitals for specialized treatment; the facility supports preventive health programs, vaccinations, and health-awareness initiatives typical of large residential institutes.

On-Campus Shopping and Dining: Various canteens, cafeterias, snack outlets, and small shops distributed across the campus, including near hostels and academic areas, offering everyday essentials, stationery, groceries, and diverse food options, thereby making the campus largely self-contained and convenient for residents.

Residential Quarters for Faculty and Staff: A sizeable inventory of apartments and staff housing integrated into the campus layout, providing convenient living arrangements for faculty and staff and enabling a vibrant, 24x7 academic community where students can interact with mentors beyond formal classroom hours.[2]

Green and Planned Campus Environment: Extensive green cover, tree-lined avenues, landscaped gardens, and pedestrian-friendly pathways that reflect the original campus planning vision of Achyut Kanvinde, promoting a healthy, aesthetically pleasing, and environmentally conscious setting conducive to both contemplation and collaboration.[1]

overview.description: Indian Institute of Technology Kharagpur (IIT Kharagpur) is the oldest IIT in India, established in 1951 as the first institution in the IIT system to spearhead the country’s post-independence technical education and industrial development.[1][4] It was founded on the site of the former Hijli Detention Camp, a colonial-era prison where Indian freedom fighters had been incarcerated, symbolically transforming a place of oppression into a hub of knowledge and nation-building.[1][4] Over the decades, IIT Kharagpur has grown from an institute focused primarily on core engineering disciplines into a comprehensive technology and research university offering programs in engineering, sciences, management, law, architecture, humanities, and emerging interdisciplinary areas.[1][3] Recognized as an Institute of National Importance under the Institutes of Technology Act and conferred Institute of Eminence status in 2019, it occupies a central role in India’s higher education landscape and innovation ecosystem.[1][3] The campus spans about 2,100 acres in Kharagpur, making it the largest among the IITs, with academic complexes, laboratories, hostels, sports facilities, and residential areas integrated into a self-contained township-like environment.[1][2][3] IIT Kharagpur enjoys a strong national and international reputation for rigorous academics, competitive admissions, high-impact research, and an alumni network that includes leading CEOs, entrepreneurs, academics, and public leaders in India and abroad.[3][4][5] Its culture is often described as academically intense yet vibrant and inclusive, with a rich tradition of student-driven clubs, national-level festivals, and interdisciplinary projects that encourage both technical excellence and holistic development.[1][3] In recent years, the institute has expanded its focus on innovation, entrepreneurship, and translational research through incubators, technology parks, and specialized centers in areas such as cryogenic engineering, rural development, intellectual property law, and railway research.[3][5] The institute consistently features among the top engineering and overall universities in India by the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) and appears in major global rankings such as QS and THE, reflecting its growing international visibility.[2][3][5] As a premier public institution, IIT Kharagpur is widely regarded as a cornerstone of India’s scientific and technological capacity, contributing significantly to skilled manpower, research output, public policy inputs, and industry collaboration across multiple sectors.[1][3][4]
