courses_and_fees.course_name: B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering (CSE)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: For Indian students, tuition is generally charged on a per-semester basis as per prevailing IIT system norms, with approximate tuition in recent years on the order of INR 1–1.25 lakh per semester for most general-category undergraduates, in addition to one-time fees, hostel charges, and mess expenses; substantial fee waivers, scholarships, and tuition remissions are available for economically weaker sections, reserved category students, and certain other categories as per Government of India and institute policies.[1][3]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission is primarily through the national-level Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) system, where candidates first qualify in JEE (Main) and then appear in JEE (Advanced); only those securing sufficiently high All India Ranks in JEE (Advanced), especially in the top national percentile range, are able to obtain a seat in the highly competitive CSE program at IIT Kharagpur.[1][3][4] Candidates must have completed 10+2 (or equivalent) schooling with Physics, Mathematics, and Chemistry (or equivalent subjects) and must satisfy minimum marks and category-wise eligibility and age criteria specified each year by the JEE organizing body and JoSAA counselling.[3][4] Cut-offs vary annually based on the number of applicants, difficulty level of JEE examinations, and seat availability, but historically the closing ranks for CSE at IIT Kharagpur have been among the best in the country, indicating extremely high competition and demand.[3]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: Tuition is broadly aligned with the standard IIT undergraduate fee structure, often around INR 1–1.25 lakh per semester for general-category students in recent years, excluding hostel and mess charges, with additional one-time institute charges; however, actual payable amounts may be significantly reduced for students availing fee waivers, scholarships, and financial assistance schemes that are mandated by the Government of India and implemented by the institute.[1][3]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission is via the JEE route, requiring qualification in JEE (Main) and a competitive performance in JEE (Advanced) followed by centralized JoSAA counselling; students must list IIT Kharagpur Mechanical Engineering as a preferred choice and secure a rank within the annually declared opening and closing ranks for their category.[1][3] Aspirants must have completed 10+2 with Physics, Mathematics, and Chemistry (or other permitted combinations) and meet the minimum percentage and category-specific cut-off criteria; seat allocation is strictly merit-based and varies year to year depending on rank distributions and seat matrix.[3][4]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The tuition structure follows the IIT system norms for undergraduate engineering programs, typically involving a per-semester tuition component (around INR 1–1.25 lakh in recent years for general-category students), along with hostel, mess, and other institutional charges; several scholarships, education loans, and fee concessions are available to ensure financial constraints do not hinder meritorious students.[1][3]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission is based on JEE (Main) qualification followed by JEE (Advanced), with candidates required to obtain a high enough All India Rank to be allotted Electrical Engineering at IIT Kharagpur through JoSAA counselling; historically, this branch also attracts strong competition, resulting in relatively high cutoffs.[1][3][4] Applicants must have completed 10+2 or equivalent with Physics and Mathematics as compulsory subjects and must satisfy board marks criteria and category-wise eligibility as notified annually by the examination authorities.[3]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: B.Tech Civil Engineering tuition is similar to other B.Tech programs at IIT Kharagpur under the unified undergraduate fee framework, with per-semester tuition commonly in the INR 1–1.25 lakh range for general-category students in recent fee structures, plus hostel, mess, and miscellaneous fees; multiple central and institute-level scholarships, fee waivers, and assistantships may reduce effective costs for many students.[1][3]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Selection is through the JEE (Main) and JEE (Advanced) process followed by JoSAA seat allocation; candidates must secure a rank within the announced opening and closing ranks for Civil Engineering at IIT Kharagpur in their respective category.[1][3][4] Eligibility requires successful completion of 10+2 with Physics, Mathematics, and Chemistry (or equivalent approved subjects), along with meeting minimum performance criteria and reservation norms as defined by national regulations.[3]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: Integrated dual-degree students typically pay tuition on a semester basis similar to B.Tech students for the duration of the program, with total tuition cost spread over five years and subject to revisions as per Government of India policies and IIT Council decisions; hostel and mess charges are additional, but financial aid, scholarships, and assistantships can help offset the cumulative cost of the extended program.[1][3]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission to dual-degree programs is also via JEE (Main) and JEE (Advanced), with specific program allocations taking place during JoSAA counselling based on candidate rank, preferences, and seat availability; competition levels depend on the branch, but many dual-degree programs at IIT Kharagpur attract candidates with strong ranks due to the combined advantages of a B.Tech and M.Tech.[1][3][4] Standard 10+2 eligibility with Physics and Mathematics and qualifying marks criteria apply, with reservations and category-specific relaxations as mandated by national rules.[3]

courses_and_fees.course_name: M.Tech Programs (various specializations, e.g., Structural Engineering, Microelectronics, Manufacturing Science)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: For postgraduate M.Tech students, tuition fees are generally lower on a per-semester basis than undergraduate programs and are complemented by the possibility of GATE-based scholarships or stipends sponsored by the Government of India for eligible full-time students; in addition to tuition, students pay hostel, mess, and other institutional charges, but many M.Tech students receive financial support that substantially reduces their net cost.[1][3]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission is typically through the Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE), with candidates required to secure a valid GATE score in the relevant paper and meet institute-specific cutoff scores for different departments and specializations; some sponsored and part-time categories may have additional requirements or relaxed GATE criteria.[1][3] Applicants must hold a relevant B.E./B.Tech or equivalent degree, usually with a minimum aggregate percentage or CGPA as prescribed by the institute, and selection may further involve departmental shortlisting, interviews, or written tests for certain programs.[1][3]

courses_and_fees.course_name: M.Sc Programs (Physics, Chemistry, Mathematics, and allied disciplines)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: M.Sc programs generally have a moderate tuition fee structure relative to professional programs, with semester-wise tuition plus standard hostel and mess charges; scholarships and national fellowships (such as those linked to JAM or other schemes) may be available for meritorious students, helping to lower the effective cost of study.[1][3]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission to many IIT Kharagpur M.Sc programs is commonly through national-level examinations like JAM (Joint Admission Test for Masters) or other specified tests, depending on discipline; candidates must obtain qualifying scores and participate in centralized counselling processes where applicable.[1][3] A relevant undergraduate degree (B.Sc or equivalent) with appropriate subject combinations and minimum marks is required, and departments may specify additional prerequisites such as prior coursework in core subjects, with reservations and relaxations as per Government of India norms.[3]

courses_and_fees.course_name: MBA (Vinod Gupta School of Management – VGSoM)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The MBA program has a professional tuition fee structure, typically higher than standard postgraduate programs, with total program fees spread over four semesters and including tuition, academic fees, and other charges; the exact amount varies across admission years, but many students mitigate costs through educational loans, scholarships, and assistantships, given the strong placement record and high return on investment.[1][3]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission to the MBA program at VGSoM usually considers national-level management entrance scores such as CAT, alongside academic background, work experience (where applicable), and performance in group discussions and personal interviews conducted by the school.[1][3] Applicants must possess a bachelor’s degree in any discipline from a recognized university with a specified minimum percentage or CGPA and must satisfy eligibility norms related to category and reservation policies; the selection process emphasizes quantitative aptitude, communication skills, and managerial potential, leading to a competitive intake.[3]

courses_and_fees.course_name: LL.B. (Hons. in Intellectual Property Law) – Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The specialized IP law program follows a law-school-style fee structure, with tuition and academic charges that are generally higher than standard arts or science postgraduate courses but justified by its niche positioning and strong industry relevance; students may access scholarships, fee concessions, and education loans where applicable.[1][3]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission to the IP law program is typically through an institute-specific admission test and/or national-level law entrance scores as prescribed by the Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law, often followed by interviews or further evaluation.[1][3] Candidates must already hold a bachelor’s degree in engineering, technology, science, or a related field (as the program is oriented toward technology and IP law) and must meet minimum marks requirements and category-based eligibility norms, making it a unique technology-law interface offering among Indian institutions.[1][3]

courses_and_fees.course_name: Ph.D. Programs (Engineering, Sciences, Humanities, Management, Law, Architecture, and Interdisciplinary domains)
courses_and_fees.duration: Typically 3–5+ Years depending on discipline and research progress
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: Ph.D. scholars usually pay a modest semester-wise tuition and registration fee, but many full-time doctoral candidates receive stipends or fellowships through schemes such as Institute Assistantship, CSIR/UGC fellowships, or sponsored research grants, which cover living expenses and, in some cases, fees; thus, for a significant proportion of Ph.D. students, out-of-pocket tuition costs are relatively low.[1][3]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admissions are based on a combination of national-level exams (such as GATE, NET, or equivalent), prior academic performance at undergraduate and postgraduate levels, and departmental selection procedures that typically include research proposals, interviews, and/or written tests; specific requirements vary by department and discipline.[1][3] Applicants must generally hold a relevant master’s degree (or exceptional bachelor’s degree with strong performance in certain direct Ph.D. tracks) in an appropriate field, satisfy minimum CGPA or percentage thresholds, and meet additional criteria for sponsored, part-time, or external registration categories; admission decisions are merit-based and contingent on the availability of suitable faculty supervisors and research infrastructure.[1][3]

placements.description: IIT Kharagpur is widely known for its strong placement ecosystem, characterized by high recruitment volumes, diverse sectoral representation, and competitive compensation packages, both in domestic and international markets.[1][3] The institute organizes centralized campus placement drives with participation from leading technology, consulting, finance, analytics, core engineering, FMCG, and emerging start-up firms, which visit annually in multiple hiring phases for full-time roles and internships.[1][3] Over the years, the placement trends have shown a steady increase in the number of offers as well as in the median and average packages, reflecting the growing market value of IIT Kharagpur graduates across B.Tech, M.Tech, MBA, and other programs.[3][5] Top-performing students, particularly in computer science, electronics, and interdisciplinary tech domains, often secure premium offers including international roles and high-paying product, quant, and consulting positions, sometimes with compensation figures among the highest offered in the IIT system for that recruitment season.[3] Core engineering branches also see robust recruitment by public-sector units, heavy engineering firms, automotive and manufacturing companies, and research organizations, indicating the institute’s continued relevance to traditional industry sectors.[1][3] Internship opportunities are abundant, with many students undertaking summer internships at reputed multinational corporations, R&D labs, financial institutions, and start-ups, which often convert into pre-placement offers and provide early industry exposure.[3][5] The institute’s alumni network plays a supportive role in placements and internships by facilitating corporate outreach, mentoring, and referrals, especially in global technology and management roles.[3][4] Placement seasons at IIT Kharagpur are extensively coordinated through dedicated career development/placement cells that manage company interactions, pre-placement talks, tests, interviews, and logistics, helping streamline the recruitment process for both students and recruiters.[1][3] While specific figures for a given year vary with economic conditions and company hiring patterns, IIT Kharagpur is routinely cited in media and education portals as recording multiple offers above the INR 30–40 lakh per annum range for undergraduates, with some exceptional domestic and international offers exceeding that band significantly.[3][5] Overall, the placement scenario at IIT Kharagpur is regarded as highly favorable, offering graduates strong career starts in industry, academia, research, public service, and entrepreneurship, thereby reinforcing the institute’s reputation for producing employable and industry-ready talent.[1][3][5]
placements.highest_package: Recent placement seasons at IIT Kharagpur have reported some of the highest cost-to-company (CTC) figures among Indian engineering institutes, with select international and specialized technical roles crossing several tens of lakhs of rupees per annum, and in some years reputed to reach or exceed the crore-level mark in overall CTC when including stock options and international components (exact numbers vary by year and employer).[3][5]
placements.average_package: Average and median salary figures vary by program and graduating batch, but for flagship B.Tech and dual-degree branches, they have generally been in a strong range relative to national benchmarks, often cited in the upper-middle bracket for IITs, reflecting consistently good compensation outcomes; postgraduate programs such as M.Tech and MBA also record competitive average packages commensurate with their specialization and industry demand.[3][5]

facilities: Central Library: IIT Kharagpur hosts a large central library system that serves as a comprehensive knowledge hub, housing hundreds of thousands of volumes of books, journals, theses, and digital resources across engineering, science, management, law, and humanities, supported by online databases, e-journals, and digital repositories accessible to students and faculty.[1][3]

Departmental Libraries and Resource Centres: In addition to the central library, most departments operate their own specialized libraries and reading rooms that curate discipline-specific textbooks, reference works, research monographs, and technical reports, thereby enabling focused academic and research study in niche areas.[1][3]

Hostels (Halls of Residence): The campus includes numerous hostels for male and female students, collectively accommodating thousands of residents with facilities such as furnished rooms, common rooms, messes, recreational areas, and internet connectivity, fostering a strong hall culture and community life that is integral to the IIT Kharagpur student experience.[1][3]

Academic and Classroom Complexes: Modern academic buildings with lecture halls, smart classrooms, seminar rooms, and studio spaces support large undergraduate lectures as well as small-group discussions and project-based learning, often equipped with audio-visual technology and IT infrastructure.[1][3]

Advanced Laboratories and Research Centres: IIT Kharagpur hosts several advanced labs including India’s first Cryogenic Engineering Centre, Central Research Facility, and specialized facilities for microelectronics, materials science, biotechnology, and other frontier areas, enabling cutting-edge experimental research and interdisciplinary collaborations.[1][3]

Technology Incubation & Entrepreneurship Training Society (TIETS): The TIETS and associated incubation ecosystem provide infrastructural, mentoring, and networking support to student and faculty start-ups, offering office space, prototyping facilities, and business development assistance to translate ideas into viable ventures.[3]

Science and Technology Entrepreneurs’ Park (STEP): STEP functions as an incubation and innovation hub that has supported hundreds of ventures, linking academic research with commercialization and providing an environment where early-stage companies can access technical guidance, business mentoring, and industry connect.[3]

Computer and IT Infrastructure: The institute offers extensive computing facilities, including department-level labs, campus-wide high-speed network connectivity, data centers, and access to licensed software, supporting both academic coursework and computational research requirements across disciplines.[1][3]

Sports and Recreation Facilities: IIT Kharagpur provides large playgrounds, athletics tracks, indoor sports complexes, gymnasiums, and courts for games such as cricket, football, basketball, tennis, badminton, and table tennis, along with organized sports events and institute-level teams that promote physical fitness and team spirit.[1][3]

Student Activity Centres and Cultural Spaces: Dedicated student activity centres, auditoriums, and open-air stages host cultural festivals, technical events, dramatics, music and dance performances, debates, and other club activities that enrich campus life and promote holistic development.[1][3]

Healthcare and Hospital Facilities: The campus maintains healthcare facilities and a hospital/medical centre designed to provide primary and emergency medical care to students, faculty, staff, and their families, often including outpatient services, diagnostics, and pharmacy support.[1][3]

Residential Quarters and Campus Amenities: Faculty and staff housing colonies, guest houses, and visitor accommodations are integrated within the campus, along with amenities such as shopping complexes, banks, post office, eateries, and daily-need stores, giving the campus a self-contained township character.[1][3]

Transportation and Connectivity: Internal transport facilities and road networks connect various hostels, academic buildings, and residential zones, while the campus’s proximity to Kharagpur’s railway junction—known for having one of the world’s longest platforms—offers convenient connectivity to Kolkata and other Indian cities.[2][3]

Rural Development and Community Outreach Centres: Through centres such as the Rural Development Centre and National Service Scheme (NSS) activities, IIT Kharagpur engages in community development, technology dissemination, and social outreach initiatives in surrounding regions, demonstrating its commitment to inclusive growth and social responsibility.[1][3]

Specialized Schools and Interdisciplinary Units: Facilities dedicated to the Vinod Gupta School of Management, Rajiv Gandhi School of Intellectual Property Law, architecture and planning, and other interdisciplinary schools provide purpose-built infrastructure—classrooms, moot courts, design studios, and project labs—suited to their distinct pedagogical and professional needs.[1][3]

overview.description: Indian Institute of Technology Madras (IIT Madras) is a premier public technical and research university established in 1959 with academic, technical and financial assistance from the Government of the Federal Republic of Germany, making it one of the earliest and most prominent Indo‑German higher‑education collaborations.[1][2] The institute was formally inaugurated in 1959, and in 1961 it was declared an Institute of National Importance by an Act of Parliament, cementing its mandate to serve as a key driver of India’s scientific and technological development.[1][2] IIT Madras has since grown into a comprehensive technological university with 18 academic departments and numerous interdisciplinary centres, covering core engineering disciplines, sciences, management, humanities, and cutting‑edge emerging areas of technology.[1][3] It has consistently been ranked among the top engineering institutions in India and is widely regarded as one of the most prestigious IITs, regularly securing the top position in the National Institutional Ranking Framework (NIRF) engineering category and performing strongly in overall and innovation categories.[1] The campus spans roughly 630 acres in South Chennai and is known for its lush, forested environment adjoining Guindy National Park, hosting rich biodiversity including deer and a variety of flora and fauna, which contributes to a unique and tranquil academic atmosphere.[2] Historically, IIT Madras played a central role in building India’s engineering workforce through its strong undergraduate programs, while steadily expanding its postgraduate, doctoral and research footprint, and it now hosts thousands of UG, PG, MS and PhD scholars along with a large faculty body engaged in sponsored projects and industrial consultancy.[2][3] The Indo‑German collaboration shaped its early laboratories, workshops and curriculum, with German professors and advanced equipment helping to build a strong experimental and research culture that continues through state‑of‑the‑art facilities and the IIT Madras Research Park, India’s first university‑based research park dedicated to industry–academia collaboration and entrepreneurship.[1][2] In recent years, IIT Madras has launched high‑impact initiatives such as NPTEL (National Programme on Technology Enhanced Learning) to distribute high‑quality course content across India, new interdisciplinary centres, and an international branch campus in Zanzibar, reflecting its ambition to influence global higher education and technology development.[1][3][5] The campus culture at IIT Madras is known for its intense academic rigor coupled with vibrant student life, characterized by technical clubs, innovation hubs like the Centre for Innovation (CFI), cultural and technical festivals, strong hostel communities, and a growing startup ecosystem anchored in the research park and incubation cells.[1][3] Through its alumni, who occupy leadership positions in academia, industry, government, and entrepreneurship worldwide, and through its active engagement with national missions, policy bodies and strategic industries, IIT Madras holds a significant place in India’s innovation ecosystem and continues to shape the country’s technological and socio‑economic landscape.[1][2][3]

rankings: NIRF India Rankings 2023 – Engineering: Ranked #1 among engineering institutions in India, continuing a multi‑year streak where IIT Madras has consistently topped the NIRF Engineering category, reflecting its strong teaching, research, and perception scores.[1]

NIRF India Rankings 2023 – Overall: Ranked #1 overall among all higher‑education institutions in India, indicating its leadership not only in engineering but also in broader academic and research performance metrics.[1]

NIRF India Rankings (multiple years): IIT Madras has held the #1 position in the NIRF Engineering category for several consecutive years (including 2016 onward), demonstrating sustained excellence in faculty quality, research output, graduation outcomes, and industry linkages.[1]

Institute of Eminence (IoE) status: Recognized by the Government of India as an Institute of Eminence, a designation given to a small set of top institutions with enhanced autonomy and funding to pursue world‑class research and academic standards.[1]

QS World University Rankings – Subject: Consistently features among the top global universities in engineering and technology subjects in the QS subject rankings, with strong performance in metrics such as academic reputation, employer reputation and citations per faculty.[1]

QS Asia University Rankings: Regularly appears as one of the highest‑ranked Indian institutions in the QS Asia rankings, underscoring its regional prominence and competitiveness among leading Asian universities.[1]

Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings – Engineering/Technology: Listed among the world’s notable engineering and technology universities in THE rankings, with particular strengths in industry income and research impact as reflected by citation metrics.[1]

NIRF Innovation Category: IIT Madras has achieved top positions in the NIRF innovation or related rankings, reflecting its strong ecosystem for startups, patents, technology transfer and the pioneering role of the IITM Research Park in industry collaboration.[1][3]

National and media rankings: Frequently ranked as the top or among the top engineering institutes in India by various media and independent surveys, further supporting its reputation among students, employers and academic peers.[1]

International visibility: Through its research output, global collaborations, and initiatives such as the Zanzibar campus and extensive online education programs, IIT Madras has been increasingly visible in international benchmarking exercises and global ranking discussions, even when exact band positions vary year to year.[1][3][5]

courses_and_fees.course_name: B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering (CSE)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: Tuition for B.Tech programs at centrally funded technical institutions like IIT Madras is typically charged on a per‑semester basis and has historically been in the range of around INR 1–1.25 lakh per semester for general‑category students, with exemptions or significant fee remissions available for SC/ST students and income‑based scholarships for economically weaker sections; additional charges such as hostel fees, mess charges, and one‑time deposits apply, and exact amounts are periodically revised as per Government of India and institute policies.[1]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission to the B.Tech CSE program is through the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) system, where candidates must first qualify JEE Main and then secure a high rank in JEE Advanced conducted at the national level; given the popularity and limited seats in CSE, the required All India Rank cutoff is typically among the very best in the country, often within the top few hundred ranks for the open category, and candidates must also meet eligibility conditions such as completing 10+2 (or equivalent) with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics and satisfying age and attempt limits specified by the JEE authorities.[1]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The tuition structure for B.Tech Electrical Engineering is aligned with other undergraduate engineering programs at IIT Madras, with semester‑wise tuition charges prescribed for general/OBC/EWS categories, significant fee waivers for SC/ST and certain other categories, and additional costs for hostel accommodation, mess, and student services; fees are periodically updated in line with Ministry of Education guidelines and institute decisions, and multiple scholarships and financial‑aid schemes help reduce the effective burden for eligible students.[1]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Entry to the B.Tech Electrical Engineering program requires qualification in JEE Main followed by securing a competitive rank in JEE Advanced, with candidates participating in the centralized JoSAA counseling process for seat allocation; aspirants must have completed 10+2 with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics, meet minimum performance criteria in boards as prescribed for JEE Advanced eligibility, and typically need a strong performance because Electrical Engineering is one of the high‑demand branches with relatively low closing ranks.[1]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: Mechanical Engineering B.Tech students pay tuition at the standard IIT Madras undergraduate rate, which has historically been on the order of several lakhs of rupees over the full program duration for general‑category students, while SC/ST students generally have tuition fully waived and other categories may receive partial waivers or scholarships; ancillary costs include hostel rent, mess charges, and institute fees, and the exact fee schedule is notified by the institute for each academic year.[1]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission is based on performance in JEE Advanced after qualifying JEE Main, with candidates selecting Mechanical Engineering during JoSAA counseling according to their rank and preferences; students must have passed 10+2 or equivalent with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics, satisfy JEE age and attempt conditions, and usually require a solid All India Rank though the closing ranks are somewhat more relaxed than for CSE or some circuit branches.[1]

courses_and_fees.course_name: Dual Degree (B.Tech + M.Tech) in Engineering Disciplines (e.g., Mechanical, Electrical, Civil, etc.)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The integrated dual‑degree programs combine undergraduate and postgraduate study, so tuition is charged per semester across five years at rates comparable to B.Tech for the initial years and aligned to the institute’s PG norms for the later years, though many institute and external scholarships exist for meritorious and financially needy students; overall, the total tuition across five years is higher than a standalone four‑year B.Tech but often still economical relative to pursuing separate UG and PG degrees, especially considering the stipends or assistantships some students may receive during the M.Tech phase.[1][3]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Students are admitted to dual‑degree programs via JEE Advanced in the same central counseling process as B.Tech, with specific dual‑degree branches having their own opening and closing ranks depending on popularity and seat availability; they must fulfill all JEE eligibility criteria, including 10+2 with Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics, and once enrolled, they must also meet internal academic requirements for progression from the B.Tech phase to the M.Tech phase within the integrated structure.[1]

courses_and_fees.course_name: M.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: M.Tech tuition fees at IIT Madras are generally charged per semester and are typically lower than many private institutions, with additional hostel and living expenses; many GATE‑qualified students receive monthly stipends from the Government of India (subject to prevailing regulations), which significantly offsets both tuition and living costs, and reserved‑category candidates may obtain further fee concessions or scholarships as per policy.[1][3]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission to the M.Tech CSE program is primarily through the Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) in an appropriate paper (such as Computer Science and Information Technology), with candidates required to meet department‑specific GATE cutoff scores and participate in centralized or institute‑level counseling; a relevant B.E./B.Tech degree with a minimum specified percentage or CGPA is required, and selection may also consider factors like academic record and, in some cases, interviews for specific specializations.[1][3]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: For M.Tech Mechanical and related specializations, students pay semester‑wise tuition at IIT Madras PG rates, while many GATE‑qualified students receive government fellowships that provide a monthly stipend and may also cover or ease tuition burdens; fees can differ slightly by category and year, and are complemented by institute and external scholarships for high performers and students from disadvantaged backgrounds.[1][3]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Candidates must hold a relevant B.E./B.Tech degree in Mechanical Engineering or a closely allied discipline with minimum qualifying marks and must have a valid GATE score in an appropriate paper such as Mechanical Engineering; admission decisions are based mainly on GATE rank and cutoff thresholds set by the department, with shortlisting and offers made through a centralized process and, in some cases, additional departmental criteria or interviews for specific tracks.[1][3]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: M.Sc programs in basic sciences at IIT Madras generally have a more moderate tuition structure than professional programs, with fees charged per semester and a range of scholarships and assistantships available to meritorious students; the total cost of study includes tuition, institute fees, hostel and mess charges, but is kept relatively accessible to encourage high‑quality students to pursue advanced scientific training and research.[1][3]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission to M.Sc programs in Physics, Chemistry and Mathematics is typically through national‑level entrance examinations such as the Joint Admission Test for M.Sc (JAM) conducted by the IITs, and candidates must hold a relevant bachelor’s degree (e.g., B.Sc with appropriate subject combinations) with required minimum marks; final seat allocation depends on JAM rank, category, and the options filled by the candidate during counseling.[1][3]

courses_and_fees.course_name: MBA (Master of Business Administration) – Department of Management Studies (DoMS)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The MBA program tuition at IIT Madras is structured over four semesters and is generally higher than typical M.Tech fees but still competitive compared with premier Indian business schools, with the total program fee (including tuition and some academic charges) amounting to several lakhs of rupees; students also incur hostel and living expenses, and a number of scholarships, need‑based assistance mechanisms and loan facilitation options are available for eligible candidates.[1][3]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission to the MBA program is largely based on performance in a national‑level management entrance test such as CAT, followed by shortlisting for group discussions, written ability tests or personal interviews conducted by the Department of Management Studies; candidates must possess a bachelor’s degree in any discipline with a minimum percentage or CGPA as specified by the institute, and selection considers academic record, test scores, work experience and performance in the interview process.[1][3]

courses_and_fees.course_name: PhD Programs in Engineering, Sciences, Humanities and Management
courses_and_fees.duration: Typically 3–5 Years (Full‑time; part‑time options available in some cases)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: PhD candidates at IIT Madras pay relatively modest tuition fees compared with undergraduate and professional programs, and most full‑time scholars admitted with a valid national‑level qualification (such as GATE, CSIR‑UGC NET, or other recognized tests) receive monthly fellowships or institute/externally funded assistantships that help cover living expenses; additional charges include hostel fees and contingencies, but overall, doctoral education is heavily subsidized to encourage high‑quality research.[1][3]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Eligibility for PhD programs generally requires a relevant master’s degree (or in some direct PhD routes, a high‑performance bachelor’s degree) in engineering, sciences, humanities or management with a specified minimum CGPA or percentage, along with a qualifying score in a national examination such as GATE, UGC‑NET, CSIR‑NET or equivalent; departments shortlist candidates based on academic credentials and test scores and then conduct interviews or written tests to assess research aptitude and fit with faculty interests, and working professionals may be admitted under part‑time or external registration categories subject to additional conditions.[1][3]

courses_and_fees.course_name: Interdisciplinary and Emerging Area Programs (e.g., Data Science, AI, Robotics – including online and hybrid formats)
courses_and_fees.duration: Varies by program (from shorter certificate/online programs to full degree offerings)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: For newer interdisciplinary and online programs, IIT Madras typically adopts flexible fee models that differ from regular on‑campus degrees, with some offerings being MOOC‑style NPTEL courses that are free or low‑cost for content access and carry examination or certification fees, while more comprehensive degree or diploma programs have structured tuition spread over terms; these initiatives aim to balance cost recovery with broad access, using scalable online platforms to reach a large learner base across India and abroad.[1][3]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Eligibility requirements vary substantially by program: some foundational or certification courses in areas like data science and AI may admit learners with basic mathematics and computing backgrounds, while advanced degree or diploma programs may require a bachelor’s degree in a related field and performance in an entrance test or screening process; for online programs delivered through NPTEL or similar platforms, learners often qualify via performance in proctored examinations and continuous assessments rather than traditional centralized entrance tests like JEE or GATE.[1][3]

placements.description: The placement scenario at IIT Madras is widely regarded as one of the strongest in India, with annual campus recruitment drives attracting a large number of leading national and international companies across sectors such as software, core engineering, analytics, consulting, finance, R&D and emerging technology domains.[1][3] Each academic year, the institute conducts a structured placement process organized by its dedicated placement office, typically running in multiple phases, during which undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral students participate in interviews, tests and case evaluations for a broad spectrum of roles ranging from core engineering design to product management, data science and quantitative finance.[1][3] Over the years, IIT Madras has reported consistently high placement rates, especially for B.Tech and dual‑degree students in branches like Computer Science, Electrical, Mechanical and interdisciplinary programs, with a significant proportion of eligible students receiving multiple offers or pre‑placement offers (PPOs) from their internship organizations.[1][3] Average and median compensation packages have shown an upward trend in recent placement seasons, with many programs seeing domestic average CTCs in the high single‑digit to low double‑digit lakh per annum range for core and analytics roles, and substantially higher averages for certain computer science and niche technology profiles, while international offers and leadership or specialized roles command significantly higher pay.[1] Campus placements at IIT Madras are complemented by a strong internship culture in which pre‑final year students, especially undergraduates, undertake summer internships at top companies and research organizations in India and abroad, frequently converting these internships into PPOs that secure early job offers before the main placement season.[1][3] The presence of the IITM Research Park and a vibrant startup ecosystem on and around the campus has created additional pathways for students keen on working in cutting‑edge R&D, deep‑tech ventures or entrepreneurial roles rather than only traditional corporate positions.[1][3] In addition to high‑profile software and consulting recruiters, core engineering companies in sectors such as manufacturing, automotive, energy, construction, aerospace and public sector undertakings regularly participate, providing a balanced mix of opportunities for students who prefer to work in their core disciplinary areas.[1][3] Placement support is extended to M.Tech, M.Sc, MBA and PhD students as well, with specialized roles in research, management, data analytics, teaching and industrial R&D being offered to postgraduate and doctoral candidates, often leveraging their thesis or project work.[1][3] The institute also emphasizes career development through training in soft skills, aptitude, interview preparation and domain‑specific sessions prior to the placement drives, supported by alumni interactions and mentorship, which help students better align their profiles with industry expectations and global career trajectories.[1][3] While exact year‑wise figures for highest and average packages vary depending on market conditions and recruiting patterns, IIT Madras’ long‑term trend shows robust placement outcomes, strong recruiter loyalty, and a growing diversity of roles including technology leadership, product‑based positions, and global R&D assignments, reinforcing its reputation as a premier talent pool for employers.[1][3]
placements.highest_package: Exact recent figures for the highest package vary by year and between domestic and international offers, but IIT Madras commonly records some of the top CTCs among Indian engineering institutes, with a small number of students securing very high‑value international or specialized offers well above typical domestic compensation levels.[1]
placements.average_package: Average packages differ across departments and programs; computer science and certain interdisciplinary branches often report higher averages, while core branches maintain competitive salaries, and overall averages for B.Tech and dual‑degree cohorts are generally in the upper range seen among Indian engineering colleges, reflecting strong demand from recruiters.[1][3]
major_recruiters: Startups and deep‑tech ventures incubated at IITM Research Park (various companies)

facilities: Central Library: IIT Madras has a central library that serves as a comprehensive knowledge resource for engineering, science, humanities and management, holding a large collection of books, technical reports, standards, theses, journals and digital resources; it provides access to numerous electronic databases, e‑journals and e‑books, offers study spaces and computer terminals, and supports research through document delivery, reference services and extended hours for students during peak academic periods.[1][3]

Hostels and Student Accommodation: The institute maintains multiple hostels for male and female students distributed across the campus, providing thousands of rooms along with common rooms, recreational facilities and study areas; hostel life plays a central role in the IIT Madras culture, with strong inter‑hostel communities, student councils and events, and facilities such as internet connectivity, messes, canteens and basic utilities are organized to support a residential learning environment.[1][3]

IITM Research Park: IIT Madras is home to India’s first university‑based research park, which co‑locates R&D wings of companies, startups and research labs adjacent to the academic campus, providing shared infrastructure, laboratories, office space and collaborative platforms for industry–academia interaction; it enables technology commercialization, joint research projects, internships and employment opportunities for students, and has become a model for similar parks across India.[1][3]

Teaching and Research Laboratories: Across its 18 academic departments and numerous centres, IIT Madras maintains nearly 100 laboratories equipped for experimental work in areas such as aerospace, automotive, advanced manufacturing, microelectronics, biotechnology, materials science, high‑performance computing and environmental engineering; these labs support both coursework and cutting‑edge research projects, funded by national and international agencies and often involving collaboration with industry.[1][3]

Centre for Innovation (CFI): CFI is a student‑run innovation and maker space established with alumni support, providing tools, equipment and mentoring for projects in robotics, electronics, aeromodelling, 3D printing, product design and more; it hosts multiple clubs and competition teams that participate in national and international contests, and it encourages a hands‑on, interdisciplinary culture where students convert ideas into working prototypes and startups.[1]

Classrooms and Lecture Halls: The institute offers modern lecture theatres, classrooms and seminar rooms across departments, many of which are equipped with audio‑visual systems, projectors and internet access to support technology‑enhanced learning; these spaces are used not only for regular lectures but also for workshops, guest talks, continuing education programs and industry interactions.[1][3]

Computing and IT Infrastructure: IIT Madras provides robust computing facilities that include department‑level computer labs, high‑performance computing clusters for research, campus‑wide wired and wireless networks, and access to specialized software and tools; IT services support e‑learning platforms such as NPTEL and internal learning management systems, and enable students and faculty to conduct data‑intensive research and online collaboration.[1][3]

Sports and Recreation Facilities: The campus includes sports grounds and courts for cricket, football, hockey, athletics, tennis, basketball, badminton and other games, as well as gymnasiums and indoor sports spaces; sports and physical education are encouraged as part of holistic development, and numerous inter‑hostel and inter‑IIT competitions, fitness activities and clubs run throughout the year.[1][3]

Cultural and Student Activity Spaces: IIT Madras hosts auditoriums, open‑air theatres and student activity centres that serve as venues for cultural festivals, technical festivals, club events, lectures and performances; flagship events such as cultural and technical fests bring together students from across India, while numerous clubs in music, arts, literature, speaking, drama and related areas contribute to a dynamic campus culture.[1][3]

Medical and Health Services: The institute operates a hospital or health centre on campus that provides primary medical care, emergency services and basic diagnostics for students, staff and their families; it is supported by referral linkages to specialized hospitals in Chennai when advanced treatment is needed, ensuring that the residential community has access to essential healthcare.[1][3]

Campus Transport and Utilities: Given its large and wooded campus, IIT Madras runs internal bus or shuttle services and maintains a network of roads and pathways that connect hostels, academic buildings, the research park and residential areas; essential utilities such as power, water, waste management and security are managed to support 24/7 academic and residential operations.[1][2][3]

Green and Biodiverse Campus Environment: The campus is set within a protected forested area adjoining Guindy National Park and features significant biodiversity including deer and diverse bird species, creating a unique ecological setting among Indian universities; this green environment is interwoven with academic buildings and hostels, offering natural trails, shaded avenues and a peaceful backdrop that supports both study and recreation.[1][2]

Heritage Centre and Archives: IIT Madras maintains a Heritage Centre located in the administration building, which preserves and displays documents, photographs, instruments and memorabilia related to the institute’s history, including its Indo‑German origins and milestones; it serves as an educational resource and a repository of institutional memory, used by students, visitors, researchers and alumni to understand the evolution of the campus and its contributions.[1][2][6]

NPTEL and Digital Learning Infrastructure: As the coordinating institute for the National Programme on Technology Enhanced Learning, IIT Madras hosts studios, recording facilities, servers and support teams that produce and disseminate massive open online courses and digital content; this infrastructure supports both on‑campus blended learning and large‑scale outreach to learners across India and abroad, making IIT Madras a central node in India’s digital education ecosystem.[1][3]

Faculty and Staff Housing, Community Facilities and Amenities: In addition to student hostels, the campus contains residential quarters for faculty and staff, schools and crèches for children, shopping complexes, banks, post office outlets, eateries and other amenities that make it a largely self‑contained township; this integrated environment fosters close interaction among faculty, students and staff, supporting long‑term research collaboration and a strong sense of community.[2][3]

overview.campus_size: Main Roorkee campus ~356 acres plus Saharanpur campus and an extension centre at Greater Noida
overview.description: Indian Institute of Technology Roorkee (IIT Roorkee) is one of India’s oldest and most prestigious technical institutions, with its origins dating back to 1847 when it was founded as the College of Civil Engineering to train engineers and surveyors for the construction of the Ganges Canal.[1][3] Over time, it became Thomason College of Civil Engineering and later the University of Roorkee in 1949, marking its elevation as the first engineering university of independent India.[1][2] In 2001, the Government of India upgraded it to an Indian Institute of Technology, making it the seventh IIT and declaring it an Institute of National Importance, which significantly enhanced its academic autonomy and national role.[1][2] The institute today comprises more than 20–23 academic departments and centres spanning engineering, architecture, sciences, management, and humanities, with strong emphasis on cutting-edge research and interdisciplinary education.[1][5] IIT Roorkee has built a powerful reputation for excellence in core engineering fields such as civil, electrical, mechanical, and water resources, while also emerging as a strong player in computer science, electronics, and emerging technologies.[1][3] The campus culture blends a deep historical legacy with a vibrant student life, reflected in large-scale events like Thomso (its flagship cultural festival) and Cognizance (its technical festival), alongside numerous student clubs in robotics, motorsports, entrepreneurship, music, and literature.[1] The institute has a distinguished alumni base that includes senior government officials, chairmen of major regulatory bodies, CEOs, entrepreneurs, and academic leaders, demonstrating its influence on India’s technological and administrative landscape.[1][3] IIT Roorkee’s location at the foothills of the Himalayas contributes to a unique residential experience, with a green campus, heritage architecture, and modern infrastructure such as sports complexes, hostels, research centres, and healthcare facilities.[3] In recent decades, the institute has significantly expanded its research output, international collaborations, and funded projects in areas like water resources, renewable energy, materials, disaster management, and AI, positioning itself as a key contributor to national development priorities.[1][5][6] Through its long history, strong academic programs, and growing global visibility, IIT Roorkee continues to hold strategic significance in India’s higher education system, serving as a bridge between tradition and modern technological innovation.[1][3][4]

rankings: NIRF 2024 Engineering: Typically ranked among the top 10 engineering institutions in India; recent NIRF editions have consistently placed IIT Roorkee high due to its strong teaching, research, graduation outcomes, and perception scores.[4]

NIRF 2024 Overall: Positioned among the leading higher education institutions in India across all disciplines, reflecting its broad academic footprint beyond core engineering into sciences, management, and architecture.[4]

QS Subject Rankings – Engineering & Technology: Frequently appears in the global subject rankings for engineering and technology, reflecting its strength in civil, mechanical, electrical, and computer science disciplines.[8][4]

Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings: Featured in THE world rankings as one of India’s prominent technical universities, benefiting from high scores in citation impact, industry income, and international outlook.[3]

THE Asia University Rankings: Recognized within the Asia region as a leading public technical institute, with its heritage, research productivity, and graduate employability contributing to its position.[3][4]

National and sectoral rankings: Several independent national surveys and media rankings consistently classify IIT Roorkee as a top-tier engineering and technology institute in India, highlighting its legacy and academic quality.[4]

Reputation among employers: Employers’ perception surveys, as used in QS and other rankings, indicate strong demand for IIT Roorkee graduates in core engineering, IT, consulting, and public sector roles, positively influencing its ranking metrics.[8][4]

Research and innovation indicators: The institute’s performance in research citations, patent activity, and funded projects is a key factor in improved rankings over time, particularly in engineering, water resources, and emerging technology domains.[4][5]

courses_and_fees.course_name: B.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering (CSE)
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: For Indian nationals in the general/OBC category, tuition fees at IITs including IIT Roorkee are typically in the range of INR 1–2 lakh per semester, with additional charges for hostel, mess, and one-time institute fees; fee waivers or reductions are frequently available for SC/ST, PwD, and economically weaker sections as per Government of India norms.[5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission is primarily through the Joint Entrance Examination (JEE) system, requiring the candidate to qualify JEE Main and then secure a high rank in JEE Advanced to obtain a CSE seat at IIT Roorkee, with closing ranks generally among the most competitive in the institute.[1][5] Candidates must have completed 10+2 (or equivalent) with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics, meeting minimum aggregate marks and category-wise criteria prescribed by the Joint Seat Allocation Authority (JoSAA); reservation policies for SC/ST/OBC-NCL/EWS/PwD apply as per government regulations.[1][5]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The tuition structure is similar to other B.Tech programs, with semester-wise tuition around the IIT system level (approximately INR 1–2 lakh per semester for general category, subject to periodic revisions), along with hostel, mess, and other institutional charges; significant subsidies or waivers exist for reserved categories and low-income students.[5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Entry is via JEE Advanced after qualifying in JEE Main, and candidates must list IIT Roorkee in their choices during JoSAA counselling, with civil engineering drawing candidates interested in core infrastructure and water resources areas.[1][5] Academic eligibility requires successful completion of 10+2 with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics, minimum qualifying marks, and compliance with age and attempt limits defined by the JEE governing bodies.[1]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: Tuition fees follow the standard undergraduate IIT structure (roughly INR 1–2 lakh per semester for general/OBC students), plus hostel, mess, and miscellaneous charges; scholarships, fee remissions, and government schemes are available for meritorious and financially disadvantaged students.[5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Candidates must clear JEE Main and then JEE Advanced with a rank high enough to obtain Electrical Engineering at IIT Roorkee in the national JoSAA counselling, where category-wise opening and closing ranks are announced annually.[1][5] Students must have a strong academic record in 10+2 with PCM subjects, and meet other JEE eligibility criteria including age, nationality (or OCI/PIO status), and number of attempts.[1]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: Mechanical Engineering students pay the standard B.Tech tuition level for IIT Roorkee, aligned with the IIT system fees, along with infrastructure, hostel, and mess fees; fee structures can be periodically updated by the Board of Governors and are accompanied by need-based assistance mechanisms.[5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admissions are conducted through JEE Advanced after JEE Main, with candidates choosing Mechanical Engineering at IIT Roorkee during online counselling; historical cutoffs indicate competitive but slightly broader ranks than CSE or ECE, depending on category.[1][5] Students must have passed 10+2 with Physics, Chemistry, and Mathematics, fulfilling minimum percentage norms and any institute-specific medical or fitness requirements for engineering disciplines where applicable.[1]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The B.Arch program’s tuition is broadly comparable to other undergraduate programs in the institute, though total cost over five years is higher due to the extra academic year; in addition to tuition, students incur studio, material, hostel, and mess expenses, which are partly offset by scholarships for eligible students.[5]
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission to B.Arch at IITs requires qualifying the architecture stream of JEE (earlier JEE Advanced AAT or equivalent architecture aptitude component), along with meeting the general JEE Main and Advanced criteria; candidates must participate in central counselling processes to secure a seat.[1][5] A 10+2 qualification with Mathematics and required aggregate marks in a recognized board is mandatory, and portfolio or aptitude assessments may be integrated through standard national tests specified annually by JEE authorities.[1]

courses_and_fees.course_name: M.Tech in Civil Engineering / Water Resources / Structural Engineering
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: M.Tech tuition fees for Indian students are generally lower on a per-semester basis than B.Tech, with additional financial support through teaching or research assistantships funded by the Ministry of Education for GATE-qualified candidates, effectively offsetting tuition and living costs for many students.[5] Exact tuition is typically in the tens of thousands of rupees per semester, exclusive of hostel and mess charges, and may differ by category and year of admission.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission is primarily based on a valid Graduate Aptitude Test in Engineering (GATE) score in a relevant paper (such as CE for Civil Engineering), followed by institute-level counselling or interviews where applicable.[5] Applicants must hold a relevant B.E./B.Tech degree (or equivalent) in civil engineering or allied disciplines with a minimum CGPA/percentage as specified by the institute, and reservations apply according to Government of India rules.[5]

courses_and_fees.course_name: M.Tech in Computer Science and Engineering / Data Science-related specializations
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: Tuition fees for M.Tech programs in computing disciplines follow the general postgraduate fee structure of IIT Roorkee, usually involving modest tuition per semester supplemented by stipends for eligible GATE-qualified students under government assistantship schemes.[5] Students also pay hostel, mess, and nominal institute service charges, while research grants and projects can provide additional financial support.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Candidates need a strong GATE score in Computer Science and Information Technology (CS) or a related paper and must satisfy minimum academic requirements in a B.E./B.Tech or equivalent degree in CSE/IT or closely allied fields.[5] Shortlisting may involve cutoffs and subsequent interviews or written tests for certain specializations, and reservation, EWS, and PwD criteria are applied as per national policy.[5]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: M.Sc programs generally have tuition that is lower than engineering postgraduate programs, with semester fees in a moderate range, in addition to hostel and mess charges; students may also access institute or external fellowships for meritorious performance.[5] The total cost over two years is designed to remain accessible, given the academic and research-oriented nature of these degrees.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Admission may be through national-level exams such as JAM (Joint Admission Test for M.Sc) or institute-specified procedures, with candidates required to have an appropriate bachelor’s degree in the relevant science subject and minimum marks or CGPA.[5] Category-based relaxations in qualifying marks and seat distribution are implemented in accordance with central government regulations.[5]

courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: The MBA program at IIT Roorkee follows a professional-program fee model, typically higher than standard M.Tech/M.Sc programs but competitive with other leading management institutes in India, and may be payable term-wise across four semesters; exact amounts are periodically revised by the institute.[5] In addition to tuition, students incur hostel, mess, and activity charges, with some access to loans and scholarships.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: MBA admissions commonly consider national-level management aptitude tests such as CAT along with academic record, work experience, and performance in group discussions and personal interviews conducted by the institute’s management department.[5] A bachelor’s degree in any discipline with a minimum percentage or CGPA is required, and the program follows IIT and Government of India norms on reservations and category relaxations.[5]

courses_and_fees.duration: Typically 3–6 Years depending on discipline and research progress
courses_and_fees.total_tuition_fee: PhD scholars pay a relatively low tuition per semester compared to coursework-heavy degrees, and many receive fellowships from the Ministry of Education, sponsored projects, or external funding bodies that cover tuition and provide a monthly stipend.[5] Additional expenses include hostel, mess, and research-related costs, some of which can be reimbursed through project grants or departmental support.
courses_and_fees.eligibility: Applicants must hold a relevant master’s degree (or in some cases a strong bachelor’s degree with exceptional performance) in engineering, sciences, management, or humanities, along with valid GATE/NET or equivalent qualifications where required.[5] Admission typically includes shortlisting based on academic record and test scores followed by interviews and/or written tests conducted by respective departments, with final selection contingent on research aptitude and availability of supervisors and funding.[5]

placements.description: The placement ecosystem at IIT Roorkee is well-known for its strong industry connect, diverse recruiter base, and consistently high offer statistics across core engineering, IT, finance, analytics, and consulting domains.[3][4][5] The institute’s Training and Placement Cell coordinates a structured recruitment process that includes pre-placement talks, aptitude tests, interviews, and group discussions, ensuring students are well prepared and that companies can efficiently identify suitable candidates.[5] Over the years, IIT Roorkee has seen an upward trend in both average and median salary packages, with especially high figures in computer science, electronics, and interdisciplinary programs, while core branches also secure robust compensation commensurate with their specialized skill sets.[4] Campus placements often feature marquee global technology firms, high-frequency trading companies, consulting giants, and leading Indian conglomerates, many of which have long-standing recruiting relationships with the institute.[4][5] The institute also places significant emphasis on internships, with students typically undertaking summer internships at top companies or research laboratories, which often convert to pre-placement offers (PPOs) for high performers.[5] IIT Roorkee’s strong alumni network, spanning sectors like infrastructure, IT, public administration, and entrepreneurship, contributes to placement opportunities by opening new recruiter relationships and mentoring current students.[1][3] Though exact figures vary year to year, the campus routinely records multiple crore-level (multi-million INR) domestic and international offers for top candidates, especially in software engineering and quantitative roles, alongside a broad base of mid-to-high range packages across disciplines.[4] Average packages for flagship branches are typically in the higher single-digit to low double-digit lakh per annum range for domestic roles, with specialized and niche roles in finance or product-based tech companies often offering significantly more.[4] Beyond placements, many students pursue higher studies at top global universities, supported by the institute’s reputation and strong recommendation culture, which reflects the dual emphasis on industry careers and research pathways.[3][5] Overall, the placement scenario at IIT Roorkee illustrates a mature, diversified, and steadily improving ecosystem that balances domestic and international opportunities and aligns with evolving industry trends and technological shifts.[4][5]
placements.highest_package: Frequently reported in the multi-crore INR range for select international or highly specialized domestic roles in recent years, particularly in software, quant, and analytics profiles (exact numbers vary by year and recruiter policies).
placements.average_package: Typically falls in the higher single-digit to low double-digit lakh per annum range for B.Tech and slightly lower but still competitive levels for some other programs, with notable variation by branch, role type, and market conditions.
major_recruiters: Apple (for select roles through global recruitment channels)

facilities: Central Library: IIT Roorkee’s central library is a large, well-equipped facility housing hundreds of thousands of volumes of books, periodicals, theses, and digital resources, supporting teaching and advanced research across engineering, sciences, and humanities.[5] It offers modern reading halls, digital access to e-journals and databases, inter-library loan services, and specialized collections in legacy areas such as water resources and civil engineering.

Departmental and Specialized Libraries: In addition to the central library, many academic departments maintain their own focused libraries or reading rooms, which provide highly specialized books, reference material, technical standards, and research reports tailored to departmental needs.[5] These smaller libraries enhance accessibility of core resources and support project work and postgraduate research.

Hostel Accommodation: The institute provides extensive residential facilities for students, including multiple hostels for undergraduate, postgraduate, and doctoral students, with options for single and shared rooms.[3][5] Hostels are equipped with internet connectivity, common rooms, indoor games, basic mess facilities, and wardenship arrangements, creating a residential campus culture that supports academic engagement and peer learning.

Sports and Recreation Facilities: IIT Roorkee maintains a range of outdoor and indoor sports infrastructure, including grounds for cricket, football, athletics, basketball and tennis courts, as well as gymnasiums and indoor facilities for badminton, table tennis, and other sports.[3] These facilities are complemented by regular inter-hostel events, institute sports teams, and fitness programs, fostering a holistic environment promoting physical well-being.

Advanced Research Laboratories: The institute hosts numerous advanced laboratories across its engineering and science departments, covering areas like structural engineering, fluid mechanics, microelectronics, nanotechnology, materials science, and environmental engineering.[5] Many labs are funded through national and international research grants and house sophisticated equipment, enabling high-quality experimental research and sponsored projects.

Computing and IT Infrastructure: IIT Roorkee provides robust computing facilities including high-speed campus networks, computer centers, departmental labs, and access to licensed software and computational tools for students and faculty.[5] High-performance computing resources and specialized servers support research in data-intensive fields such as computational fluid dynamics, machine learning, and simulations.

Campus Health Services and Hospital: A campus hospital or health centre caters to the medical needs of students, faculty, staff, and their families, offering outpatient services, basic inpatient facilities, and emergency care.[3] The availability of doctors, nursing staff, and diagnostic services within campus helps maintain a safe and healthy residential environment.

Banks, Post Office, and Utility Services: The Roorkee campus functions like a small township, with on-campus branches of major banks, ATMs, a post office, and various essential services that cater to everyday requirements of the campus community.[3] These facilities reduce dependency on the town for basic banking and administrative transactions and support the self-contained nature of the institute.

Student Activity Centres and Auditoriums: Multiple auditoriums, lecture halls, and student activity centres host cultural events, festivals such as Thomso, technical festivals like Cognizance, lectures by distinguished visitors, and club activities.[1][5] These venues are technically equipped with modern audio-visual systems and provide spaces for drama, music, debates, and student governance meetings.

Cafeterias and Dining Facilities: Apart from hostel messes, the campus features canteens and cafeterias offering varied cuisines and snacks, serving as social hubs where students and staff interact informally.[3] Mess committees and student bodies often participate in managing quality and menu choices, contributing to a participatory campus culture.

Saharanpur Campus Facilities: The Saharanpur campus, which primarily houses the Department of Paper Technology, includes academic buildings, specialized labs, and residential amenities similar to the main campus, though on a smaller scale.[1][3] It is connected to Roorkee by good transport links and serves as an important extension for specific academic and research programs.

Greater Noida Extension Centre: IIT Roorkee is developing an extension centre on a 10-acre campus at Greater Noida to enhance outreach, continuing education, executive programs, and industry interface activities closer to the National Capital Region.[3] This centre provides modern classrooms, seminar spaces, and facilities tailored to short-term courses, workshops, and collaborative programs with industry.

Entrepreneurship and Innovation Facilities: The institute supports entrepreneurial ventures through incubation and innovation centres that provide co-working spaces, mentoring, and access to funding networks for student and faculty startups.[4][5] These facilities work in tandem with entrepreneurship cells and alumni networks to promote a start-up culture on campus.

Community Centres and Clubs Infrastructure: Dedicated spaces for student clubs, faculty and staff community centres, and common halls are available for organizing social, cultural, and professional development activities.[3][5] These facilities encourage a sense of community, facilitate interdisciplinary interaction, and support the diverse interests of the campus population.

Transportation and Campus Mobility: Well-maintained internal roads, parking areas, and connectivity to nearby railway stations and highways ensure convenient access to and within the campus.[3] The relatively compact yet expansive green campus allows for walking and cycling, while transport services help connect different parts of the main and off-campus locations.
